title: Ad Specialist (Philippines)
description:
#jobopp

Looking for Ad Specialist (Philippines based)

Remote • Full-Time • (40 hours per week)





About the Role

We are looking for an Ad Specialist to own paid performance across multiple client accounts.

You will be responsible for planning, launching, optimising, and reporting on paid media campaigns, with a strong focus on commercial outcomes, not vanity metrics.

This is a hands-on role. You will be inside ad accounts daily, testing, improving, and making clear recommendations to both the company and our clients.



Requirements

What we’re looking for: EXPERIENCED only please

• Strong hands-on experience with Meta, Google, and TikTok Ads

• Proven experience running ads for eCommerce or DTC brands

• Deep understanding of catalogue and product-based advertising

• Experience with server-side tracking and GTM at a practical level

• Strong UTM implementation and reporting experience

• Ability to write copy and improve creative, not just brief it

• Outstanding written and spoken English

• Commercial mindset with a focus on outcomes

• Comfortable owning performance and making recommendations



Nice to have: 

• Experience with Shopify-based brands

• Familiarity with Klaviyo, CRO, or landing page optimisation

• Experience scaling spend responsibly

• Exposure to international markets

• Experience with Asana project management

• Experience with Shopify websites updating and creating pages 



About the brand:

Unbox partners with established eCommerce and DTC brands to turn paid media into a real growth engine.

We work with businesses that already have traction and want structure, clarity, and performance that compounds.This role is not about chasing hacks or launching ads blindly.

It is about building, running, and improving paid media systems that actually scale.



How to apply: Reply to this job ad with the subject line, Ad Specialist (with experience)



Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Performance UGC Manager – DTC & Paid Social
description:
We’re seeking a highly organized, performance-driven UGC Manager to lead creators and produce native, conversion-focused content for paid social platforms.



This role sits at the intersection of creative direction and performance marketing, owning the full UGC lifecycle from creator sourcing to delivering launch-ready assets. You’ll be responsible for building and managing a creator roster, translating strategy into high-performing short-form content, and continuously improving creative output using performance data.



Key Responsibilities



-Source, vet, and onboard UGC creators aligned with brand and campaign goals



-Manage creator workflows end-to-end, including briefs, scripts, feedback, revisions, approvals, and final delivery



-Translate strategy into clear shot lists, hooks, scripts, and CTAs optimized for TikTok, Meta, and short-form platforms



-Collaborate with strategists to ideate, test, and refine creative concepts, angles, and openers



-Coach creators on storytelling, pacing, lighting, framing, and on-camera delivery to reduce reshoots



-Manage contracts, rates, usage rights, and deliverables while tracking timelines and budgets



-Maintain a structured multi-project pipeline and ensure all assets are QC’d and launch-ready



-Use performance data to improve CTR, CVR, CPA, and ROAS



-Build repeatable UGC playbooks and best-practice documentation



Required Experience & Skills



-Proven experience in UGC management, influencer marketing, or performance creative



-Strong understanding of short-form paid social and platform best practices



-Excellent English communication with the ability to give clear, actionable feedback



-Strong eye for storytelling, authenticity, and emotional engagement



-Highly organized and capable of managing multiple creators and projects



-Performance mindset with an understanding of how creative impacts acquisition metrics



Bonus Skills



-Experience building and scaling creator databases



-Knowledge of creator licensing, usage rights, and whitelisting



-Ability to write or refine UGC scripts (testimonials, problem-solution, demos)



-Familiarity with short-form editing workflows, captions, and pacing



-Experience analyzing creative performance and sharing insights

title: Diary Department – Phone Support (Part-Time, Remote)
description:
We’re looking for a confident and friendly Phone Support / Diary Coordinator to help manage incoming leads and bookings for a photography studio.



This role is phone-heavy and customer-facing. You’ll be calling warm leads who have already expressed interest, explaining their invitation, answering questions, and booking them into the system.



Clear communication, a calm phone manner, and attention to detail are essential.



?



How Leads Come In (Background)



Leads are generated through multiple channels, including:



1.
 & Instagram Campaigns

 • Weekly lead generation campaigns (Thursday–Wednesday)

 • Offer includes a free photoshoot and one complimentary high-resolution digital image

 • Approx. 40–60 leads per week

 • Clients enter via social media forms



2. “Share the Love” Campaigns

 • Monthly, invitation-based campaign

 • Approx. 50–300 people may vote or nominate someone

 • Only clients who accept their invitation (“YES clients”) require follow-up

 • Clients receive an SMS and HTML
 prompting them to activate their invitation

 • Once activated, all YES clients require a phone call



?



Key Responsibilities



Invitation Calls

 • Call clients who have expressed interest via competitions, campaigns, or promotions

 • Clearly explain what they’ve received and how the invitation works

 • Answer questions and build excitement



Booking Calls

 • Help clients select suitable dates and times

 • Book sessions accurately in the system

 • Explain the photoshoot process and what to expect



Fire-Up Calls

 • Call clients who are already booked but haven’t yet spoken with a photographer

 • Help them prepare for their shoot (what to wear, what to bring)



?



Systems & Tools

 • CRM system (training provided)

 • Call hub with assigned phone number

 • Booking and diary management tools



?



What We’re Looking For

 • Confident phone manner with a natural, clear, non-scammer-sounding accent

 • English that sounds neutral to Australian (very important)

 • Comfortable speaking with customers and handling objections calmly

 • Strong attention to detail for notes, bookings, and CRM updates

 • Willingness to learn and follow call scripts and processes



?



Training

 • Full training provided on CRM usage, including:

 • Client status updates

 • Notes and follow-ups

 • Bookings and diary management



?



Role Details

 • Pay: AUD $7–$10/hour (based on experience)

 • Hours: 5–8 hours per week (may increase during busy periods)

 • Schedule: Flexible, based on lead flow

 • Start: ASAP



?



How to Apply



Please send:

 • Your updated resume, and

 • A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself and demonstrating your spoken English and phone manner



Applications without a Loom video may not be considered.

title: Front End Developer
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Frontend Developer who’s passionate about crafting intuitive, engaging, and high-performing web experiences. In this role, you’ll shape the look and feel of a modern ticketing platform—bringing designs to life through clean, responsive, and accessible user interfaces.



You’ll work closely with designers and backend developers to translate mockups into seamless user experiences, ensuring performance, scalability, and usability across devices and browsers. If you enjoy turning complex ideas into elegant interfaces and care deeply about user experience, this role is for you.







Key Responsibilities:



*Design and develop interactive user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript



*Translate UI/UX designs and mockups into responsive, functional web interfaces



*Collaborate closely with designers to ensure visual consistency and usability



*Work with backend developers to integrate frontend components with backend services



*Optimize web applications for performance, speed, and scalability



*Ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX designs



*Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve frontend issues during development and testing



*Stay up to date with emerging frontend trends, tools, and best practices





Focus Areas

*UI/UX Design: Build visually appealing, intuitive, and user-friendly interfaces

*Responsive Design: Ensure seamless experiences across desktops, tablets, and mobile devices

*Performance Optimization: Deliver fast-loading, efficient web applications

*Cross-Browser Compatibility: Maintain consistent behavior across major browsers

*Accessibility: Implement inclusive design practices for users with disabilities

*Security: Apply frontend security best practices to protect applications





Skills Requirements:



* Proficient in HTML, CSS, and [removed] Strong proficiency in frontend technologies is essential.



* Familiarity with modern tools: Experience with Knockout JS, Handlebars, React, Less Stylesheet, Nuxt JS, and Gulf JS. 



* UI/UX Design Skills:  Knowledge of UI/UX design principles and tools is required.



* Responsive Design:  Experience with responsive design frameworks (e.g., Bootstrap) is preferred.



* Version Control: Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) is required.



* Cross-Browser Compatibility: Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and solutions is preferred.



* Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to troubleshoot and debug issues that arise during development.



* Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.



* Team Player:  Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals and objectives.

 Kajabi | Kit | Zapier | Google Workspace | Acuity | ThriveCart | Canva Pro | Zoom | Dropbox | Showit | WordPress | Asana

Bonus experience:  iMovie / ScreenFlow / GarageBand | Slack | Captivate | Stripe | Metricool | ManyChat | AddEvent | Descript

You value integrity, excellence, and meaningful work





You enjoy working closely with a visionary leader in an intimate, mission-driven business





You’re on your own path of personal growth and want your work to contribute to something soulful and world-changing



How to Apply



Please send:

Your resume





A short paragraph describing the type of clients you thrive supporting





The 2–3 tools from the list above you feel most confident in





Your availability and hourly rate





Subject line: Admin + Operator

title: Real Estate VA (TC, Listing & Marketing)
description:
Subject Line Requirement When Applying:

Real Estate VA (TC, Listing & Marketing)



Key Responsibilities

1. Transaction Coordination (Contract to Close)

- File Compliance: Manage the end-to-end "Contract-to-Close" process using Dotloop, Skyslope, or Zipforms.

- Signatures: Coordinate and track all signatures via DocuSign.

- Deadline Tracking: Actively monitor and remind all parties of critical dates (Inspection, Appraisal, Financing).

- Communication: Serve as the liaison between the agent, clients, title companies, and lenders.



2. MLS Management & Listing Input

- Listing Entry: Manually input new property listings into the MLS with 100?curacy.

- Media Management: Upload and organize high-res photos, virtual tours, and floor plans.

- Copywriting: Draft compelling property descriptions and public remarks.

- Status Updates: Promptly update price changes, status updates (Active to Pending), and open house schedules.



3. Administrative & CRM Management

- CRM Upkeep: Manage and tag leads in the CRM to ensure no lead is left behind.

- Inbox & Calendar: Handle
 management and coordinate the agent’s daily showing and meeting schedule.



4. Content Creation & Social Media

- Design & Layouts: Create professional listing flyers, brochures, and digital assets using Canva.

- Video Editing: Perform basic video editing for Reels, TikToks, and YouTube content.

- Outreach: Draft and send monthly newsletters and manage social media posting (FB, IG, YouTube).



Required Qualifications

- Experience: Solid, proven experience as a Transaction Coordinator Assistant in the Real Estate industry.

- Software Mastery: Proficiency in Dotloop, Skyslope, DocuSign, and Zipforms

- Marketing Skills: Experience with Canva and basic video editing tools.

- Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English skills.

-  Reliability: High-speed internet and a dedicated, quiet workspace.



How to Apply:

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, a cover letter, and a link to your portfolio (showing design and video samples).

Send your application to:

title: Part-Time Sales Representative
description:
We're looking for a skilled part-time sales rep to help grow our Reddit marketing service. You'll be reaching out to companies and helping them understand how our DFY Reddit solution can become a profitable add-on for their clients.





What You'll Do



- Run discovery calls and demos to qualified prospects

- Manage your pipeline and maintain accurate records in our CRM

- Hit monthly targets for meetings booked and deals closed

- Collaborate asynchronously with the team on messaging and positioning improvements





What We're Looking For



- 2+ years of B2B sales experience, ideally selling marketing services or SaaS

- Proven track record of hitting or exceeding quota

- Comfortable running demos and discovery calls independently

- Native or near-native English communication skills

- Self-directed and comfortable working independently in a part-time capacity





Nice to Have



- Experience selling to agencies or in the digital marketing space

Details



Type: Part-time (15-20 hours/week)

Location: Remote

A screenshot of your sales dashboard or leaderboard

Something else entirely — you d
 what best proves you can sell

title: Senior Social Media Content & Marketing Manager (Daily Content Creation)
description:
About the role



We are a fast-growing UK-based e-commerce brand in the events and branding space.



We are looking for a high-quality Social Media Content & Marketing Manager who can take full ownership of our organic social presence and content output.



This role is not for beginners, schedulers, or repost-only social media assistants.



You will be responsible for creating, designing, and posting daily content across multiple platforms, with a strong focus on brand, quality, and consistency.



?

Daily

?

?

?

title: Organic Social Media Strategist (TikTok / Instagram / Youtube)
description:
Organic Social Media Strategist (TikTok / Instagram / Youtube)

Remote | Full-Time



We’re on a mission to go viral — and we need your help to maximize reach across TikTok, Instagram,
, and YouTube.



As the Organic Social Media Strategist for our natural health book brand, you’ll work directly with the founder and our editing team to create high-performing viral posts that drive engagement, followers, and sales.



About the Role:

 • Your focus is to get lots of views by understanding the first principles of social media marketing - entertainment, value, and trends.

 • You won’t edit videos, but you will own your ideas end-to-end — from trend research and scriptwriting to coordinating production and analyzing performance.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Research trends and viral content formats that fit our brand voice.

 • Write scripts and content briefs for viral short-form videos.

 • Coordinate video production with editors to ensure timely execution.

 • Post, manage, and analyze performance metrics to refine and optimize strategies.

 • Scale content output and experiment with new formats to push boundaries.



What We’re Looking For:

 • Obsessed with social media — you live and breathe viral content and know what’s trending.

 • A self-starter who takes initiative, drives projects forward, and gets things done.

 • Obsessive communicator who keeps the team aligned and informed.

 • Passionate about organic marketing, virality, and brand growth.

 • Comfortable in a fast-paced, experimental environment where we test, learn, and scale quickly



About Us:



We’re a natural health book brand selling 3,000+ books a day globally — but that’s just through paid ads. We’ve barely scratched the surface organically.



We make beautiful, full-color books about herbal remedies, food as medicine, and holistic health.



Our vibe: warm, educational, empowering, science-backed — something your mom would share on WhatsApp and you’d actually want to read.



We’re not fear-mongering. We’re here to help people live healthier, naturally.



Screening Questions (Please Answer):

 1. What experience do you have growing accounts? Please give specific numbers.

 2. Break down some content you think is good. What makes content good? What makes content bad?

title: Social Media Content Creator (Photo + Video)
description:
We are an outdoor travel business located in Australia, and are looking for someone to join our content production team (including social media). In this role you will be asked to edit and colour grade professional videos and photos. We have a long-term, full-time position for someone who has the necessary technical skills, strong English, and will communicate with us on a daily basis to develop a good working relationship.



This is an advanced role for someone who is highly experienced with Lightroom, Photoshop, and Final Cut Pro (or similar).



Responsibilities:

- Professionally edit travel and outdoor photos using Lightroom and Photoshop

- Professionally produce travel and outdoor videos using Final Cut Pro (or similar)

- Create graphics for social media accounts and other marketing material

- Schedule content on social media accounts



Requirements:

- C1 or C2 English

- Reliable internet connection

- Extensive experience with Photoshop, Lightroom and Final Cut Pro

- Colour grading experience for both photos and videos



What you get:

- Starting monthly salary of 1150 AUD based on experience (with an annual raise and potential bonuses)

- 9am - 5pm workday (Manila time)

- 13th month pay

- Paid sick leave

- 25 flexible days of paid time off (including holidays)

- Fortnightly pay

- We don’t expect or require you to use TimeProof



To apply, please attach your resume and submit a short video introduction about yourself (2-5 minutes) addressing the following points:



1. Start the video by saying 'Hello Maddie' - so we know it's not a generic video :)

2. A brief introduction about yourself.

3. What tools you like to use to edit photos and videos.

4. A specific example of a recent project you worked on - please highlight challenges faced and how you overcame them.

5. Your approach to prioritising tasks and staying organised in a dynamic work environment.



Please upload your video to a platform of your choice and share the link with us. Don't worry about production quality - content and clarity are what matter most.



When submitting an application, please use the subject line “[your name] + [your favourite dog breed]” :)



If you are shortlisted for the job, you will proceed to an interview. We look forward to reviewing your application and are excited to work with you!

title: Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a strategic Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager, not just a content poster.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who understands brand building, YouTube growth, video strategy, ads, and AI-powered marketing—someone who can think ahead, analyze data, and help grow a recognizable real estate brand with minimal supervision.



This role is not task-based. You will own the marketing direction, especially for YouTube and social platforms.



CORE FOCUS AREAS (VERY IMPORTANT)

- Brand Building – 60%

- Video Editing & Content Execution – 30%

- Other - 10%



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. YouTube

YouTube is our #1 growth channel.

You will be responsible for end-to-end YouTube management, including:



Long-form YouTube Content:

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write SEO-optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Use VidIQ for keyword research, optimization, and competitive analysis

- Upload, schedule, and publish videos

- Track performance, analytics, CTR, watch time, retention, and growth

- Continuously improve content based on data



YouTube Shorts:

- Repurpose long-form content into Shorts

- Edit, format, caption, and schedule Shorts

- Optimize hooks, pacing, and visuals for engagement



YouTube Ad

- Manage YouTube ad campaigns

- Support creative testing, hooks, thumbnails, and targeting

- Monitor performance and suggest improvements



2. Instagram &

You’ll manage and grow our presence across Meta platforms with a marketing-first mindset, not just posting.

- Create and edit Reels (intermediate level required)

- Design and schedule posts, carousels, and stories

- Write captions with strong hooks and CTAs

- Applicants must use Real Estate SMM

- Boost posts and manage sponsored content

- Handle Meta Ads at an intermediate level:

· Campaign setup

· Scheduling

· Basic optimization and monitoring

- Ensure consistency in branding, tone, and visuals



3. Google Presence & Analytics

- Manage Google My Business:

· Posts

· Updates

· Reviews

· Products/services

- Monitor Google Analytics and performance data

- Track how content and traffic support brand visibility and lead generation



4. Marketing Manager Responsibilities

You are not just executing — you are thinking like a manager.

- Plan content calendars aligned with business goals

- Propose campaigns and growth ideas

- Analyze what’s working and what’s not

- Report insights clearly and simply

- Coordinate with leadership on strategy and priorities



5. AI & Innovation

We expect you to use AI intelligently, not blindly.

- Use tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, AI video tools, etc.

- Speed up workflows while maintaining quality

- Suggest better systems, tools, and processes

- Stay updated on trends in AI, marketing, and content creation



BASIC REQUIREMENTS

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing

- Real estate experience is a strong advantage

- Proven experience managing YouTube channels

- Strong understanding of branding and content strategy

- Intermediate video editing skills (Reels, Shorts)

- Intermediate experience with Meta Ads

- Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication, organization, and time management skills



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

- Someone who thinks strategically

- Someone who understands YouTube as a growth engine

- Someone who cares about branding, consistency, and results

- Someone who takes ownership and doesn’t wait for instructions



- This role is not for beginners

- This role is not for task-only executors



COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a BC, Canada–based real estate team focused on modern marketing, strong branding, and long-term growth. We value ownership, creativity, and people who think ahead.



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please:

Send your resume / CV

Include portfolio links:

YouTube channels managed

Don't use "Rockstar VA" in your application. Read carefully again to find the correct term to use.

Thumbnails you’ve created

Reels / Shorts

Ads or campaigns you’ve worked on



We’re not looking for “just an SMM.”

We’re looking for someone who can build a brand and grow an audience.



- IMPORTANT: SKILLS TEST / TRIAL TASK -

We’ve hired many SMMs before, and not everyone performs at the level they claim.

Because of this, we will hire based on performance, not interviews.

Shortlisted applicants will complete a practical test.

The fastest and highest-quality submission will be hired.

title: Amazon Account Manager VA (Full-Time, Long-Term | Seller Central Expert)
description:
We are an Amazon-focused eCommerce agency looking to hire a Full-Time Amazon Account Management Virtual Assistant with strong Seller Central experience. This is a permanent, long-term role, NOT a freelance or side-hustle position.

We’re looking for someone who wants stability, ownership, and growth inside a serious Amazon team.



Core Responsibilities



Amazon Account Health & Compliance

• Monitor Account Health dashboard daily

• Handle policy warnings, performance notifications, negative feedback

• Support POAs and compliance-related actions



Amazon Seller Central Case Management

• Review and respond to Amazon communications

• Open, manage, and follow up on cases (listings, FBA, fees, shipments, account issues)



Inventory & FBA Management

• Create and manage FBA shipments

• Upload tracking numbers

• Monitor inventory weekly to avoid stockouts or overstock

• Monitor aging inventory and submit removal orders



Listings & Catalog Management

• Create and manage parent–child variations via flat files

• Fix upload errors and suppressed listings

• Ensure listing updates go live correctly

• Conduct keyword research using Helium 10 to support listing optimization



Promotions & Amazon Programs (Non-PPC)

• Coordinate coupons, deals, Vine, and promotions

• Support seasonal and special Amazon events



Customer Support

• Respond to buyer messages professionally and on time

• Coordinate internally for technical or after-sale questions



Reporting

• Prepare monthly reports (sales, orders, returns, inventory health, KPIs)



Reimbursements & Financial Recovery

• File claims for lost/damaged inventory

• Identify incorrect FBA fees and shipment discrepancies

• Perform account audits to recover missed reimbursements



Requirements

• Proven experience with Amazon Seller Central

• Strong understanding of FBA, listings, cases, and account health

• Excellent English (written & spoken)

• Confident with Google Sheets / Excel

• Detail-oriented, proactive, and self-managed

• Experience with Helium 10, Sellerboard, Data Dive



This Role Is NOT For You If

• You’re looking for freelance or part-time work

• You manage multiple clients or brands

• You need step-by-step daily instructions

• You want short-term work



Details

Location: Philippines preferred

Schedule: 8 hours/day | Monday–Friday | Exact working hours will be discussed and agreed upon to accommodate both parties.

Job Type: Full-Time, Long-term, Remote



Perks

• Competitive salary based on experience

• 10 Paid Days Off

• PH holidays + 13th month pay

• Long-term growth with a dedicated Amazon team



To apply:

Briefly share your Seller Central experience and confirm availability for a full-time, exclusive role.

title: Lead Follow-Up & Reactivation Specialist (Email-Based, High Volume)
description:
About the role



We are a fast-growing UK-based business generating a high volume of inbound leads.



Many of these leads have:

 • Received custom designs

 • Had
 conversations with us

 • Gone quiet or stalled



This role exists to professionally and accurately re-engage those leads.



You will be responsible for sending high-volume, personalised follow-up
s to restart conversations and bring warm leads back into active discussions.



This is not cold outreach and not aggressive sales.



?



What you will be responsible for



Daily

 • Follow up with leads who:

 1. Were sent designs and did not reply

 2. Had conversations that fizzled out

 3. Require a polite nudge or check-in

 • Send hundreds of
s per day using approved templates

 • Ensure messaging is accurate, relevant, and appropriate to the lead’s situation

 • Update lead status correctly after each follow-up



Ongoing

 • Maintain extremely high attention to detail

 • Ensure the right message goes to the right lead

 • Spot opportunities to restart conversations and flag warm replies to the sales team

 • Follow processes precisely to avoid incorrect or confusing communication



?



Skills & experience required (non-negotiable)

 • Excellent written English (professional, friendly, and clear)

 • Strong attention to detail

 • Experience with CRM systems and
 workflows

 • Comfortable working with high daily
 volume

 • Able to follow processes consistently without cutting corners



Mistakes in this role are costly — accuracy matters more than speed.



?



What this role is NOT

 • Not cold
 marketing

 • Not copywriting

 • Not closing sales

 • Not a generic VA role



This is structured, high-volume follow-up with care and precision.



?



What we are looking for

 • Calm, focused, and organised

 • Enjoys structured, repeatable work

 • Understands the importance of correct messaging

 • Reliable and consistent

 • Comfortable working with established templates and rules



?



Important – how to apply



When applying, please include:

 1. Your experience with
 follow-ups or CRM work

 2. The largest number of
s per day you’ve handled

 3. Any experience reactivating old or quiet leads

 4. Confirmation that you are comfortable with repetitive, detail-focused work



Applications without these answers will be ignored.



?



What you’ll get

 • Long-term, stable role

 • Clear processes and templates

 • Support from the sales and design teams

 • Direct feedback on what works

 • Competitive pay for a focused operational role

title: Legendary Admin Assistant
description:
A Legendary Admin Assistant Who Loves to Keep Things on Track



- Read our 7 core values here: 
/values

- Take a look at the short 2-minute video below. This is who we are as a company and team: youtu.be/5PD5tHpfpHY



- Please apply on our careers page: 
/jobs/
operations-assistant



TL;DR (because attention spans are real):

We’re hiring a full-time remote Admin & Operations Assistant to help manage a wide range of backend and administrative tasks that keep our ecommerce business running smoothly. This role it’s about precision, diligence, and execution. You’ll work closely with our operations and finance teams to support internal trackers, manage reimbursements, check calculations, and assist with backend coordination. Your attention to detail and organizational skills will be essential in supporting smooth day-to-day operations and protecting the integrity of our systems.



Time zone: Full-time within Asia

Salary: USD
per month, depending on experience

Trial Period: All candidates will complete a paid trial assignment - more details below.



???? WHO WE ACTUALLY NEED (and who we don’t)

* This isn’t for freelancers moonlighting or wanting a side hustle.

* It’s not for someone who feels uncomfortable taking initiative, and who may need a lot of handholding.



This is however for someone who:

* Has at least 2 years of experience in any administrative or operations roles.

* Is tech-savvy, resourceful, and comfortable with online work.

* Has proficiency in data entry and database management.

* Have some experience with common eCommerce tools such as Slack, Google Drive, Asana, Shopify, Klaviyo, Zipify, etc. (Advantageous but not required)

* Is effective at verbal and written communication and following up is second nature to you.

* Is a self-starter, when given resources & training, can get things done without hand-holding.

* Has a natural sense of urgency. When things arise, you’re the first to tackle them.

* Is naturally detail-oriented and organized. Someone who has their desk and bedroom clean and neat.

* Thrives in a support role and always has a positive attitude.

* Is a learner at heart and is always working on self-development.



???? WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

* Review team reimbursement submissions, and track internal payments across platforms.

* Assist with administrative tasks related to inventory, platform uploads, internal reporting, and vendor coordination.

* Double-check numbers and simple calculations provided by teammates (you don’t need to be an accountant, just comfortable with Excel or Google Sheets).

* Maintain and update internal spreadsheets and trackers - making sure all data is current, consistent, and error-free.

* Help with ad hoc operational tasks as they arise - anything from submitting requests on platforms to ensure all records are complete and organized.



???? WHAT YOU GET

* Bonus Program - When we hit our company and individual objectives

* Fully remote with async flexibility

* Unlimited vacation and sick leave days

* Paid courses, coaching, and personal growth budget to help you level up

* We trust you to own your work and drive results



???? HOW WE HIRE

We believe in being clear and respectful of your time. Here’s exactly what to expect:



1. Application form: a few short questions and mini tasks to get a feel for your thinking.

2. HR Screening interview: This is a 30 - 45 minute interview to determine initial culture and role fit

3. Technical Interview: a 30 - 60-minute conversation with the hiring manager to dig deeper into your experience, mindset, and fit.

4. Paid test assignment: a realistic task (2–3 days to complete) that reflects the kind of work you’d actually do here.

5. Final Interview: Usually with our CEO, as a final seal of approval

6. Reference calls

7. Offer + onboarding: if it’s a match, we move quickly



No ghosting.

No five-round interview circus.

Just a fair, focused process designed to find the right fit for both sides.

title: Video Editor (Videos for Paid Social)
description:
We’re Hiring: UGC & E-commerce Video Editor

Remote | Part



Compensation & Benefits

Salary: $30-$100 Pay per video (USD), Depending on experience

Performance bonus: Up to $500/month based on output and ad performance

100% remote with flexible working hours

Part
: Hours/week vary depending on need. Some weeks will have more work than others

Long-term opportunity with the potential for full time (37 hours/week) position



About the Position

We’re looking for an experienced UGC & e-commerce video editor who knows how to create content that drives purchases — not just views.

This is a performance-focused creative role where you’ll mainly be editing short-form ads for Meta ads (Instagram/Facebook) and TikTok ads. Further down the road you can be promoted to developing creative ideas/concepts.

You’ll be working with a fast-growing e-commerce agency and a creative team that values speed, ownership, and smart storytelling.



What We're Looking For

Minimum 1 year of experience editing UGC or performance-driven e-commerce content, with a strong creative sense

Strong understanding of hooks, pacing, CTA structure, and social-first formats

Ideally, previous work with a DTC brand or performance team

Clear communicator in English who can explain creative decisions

Proactive mindset — someone who can bring their own ideas

title: Part-Time Social Media Video Editor (CapCut) - Long-Term Role
description:
I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented video editor to help me produce short-form social content (Instagram Reels, 
 and
) for multiple brands across different industries.



This is a long-term, part-time role with consistent weekly hours and room to grow as my business grows.



I run a content studio and handle strategy, filming and creative direction. Your role is to take the raw footage I provide and turn it into clean, engaging, polished edits that match my style consistently.



This is not a “creative director” role.

Consistency, accuracy and attention to detail matter more than flashy ideas.



If you enjoy structured work and following clear systems, you’ll do very well here.



Hours & Pay:



5 hours per week (approx. 20 hours per month)

$150 USD per month

Ongoing work with high potential for more hours over time



You will be responsible for:



• editing short-form videos in CapCut

• trimming clips and tightening pacing

• cutting to music/beats

• adding captions and on-screen text

• applying colour adjustments and brand styles

• exporting ready-to-post files

• following instructions and references closely



You should have:



• strong CapCut experience

• experience editing Reels or TikTok content

• good sense of pacing and timing

• understanding of short-form engagement (fast hooks, tight cuts, minimal dead space)

• strong attention to detail

• reliable internet and communication

• ability to follow instructions accurately



How we work:



• I provide footage, references and examples

• I give clear instructions

• I send video feedback using screen recordings

• We refine the style together



My goal is to build a long-term working relationship where you learn my editing style and can confidently deliver videos with minimal revisions.



This role is ideal for someone who:



• likes organised, repeatable tasks

• enjoys clean, polished edits

• wants stable, ongoing work

• prefers clear direction instead of guessing



To apply please include:



1. “RAKO” in your subject line

2. your internet speed

3. 2–3 short-form videos you’ve edited

4. what editing software you use daily



If this sounds like you, I’d love to see your work.

Apply with the details above and I’ll be in touch with shortlisted candidates soon.



- Joseph

title: Marketing Team Project Manager
description:
We are a fast-growing marketing agency managing 100+ clients monthly. We’re looking for a Marketing Manager to oversee a team of marketers, ensuring campaigns meet CPA targets, client health stays on track, and reporting/SOPs are consistently followed. You will coach marketers, monitor dashboards, identify at-risk clients, and implement corrective actions, while maintaining smooth workflows and high client satisfaction.



Responsibilities:

-Monitor client performance and campaign health; take action on at-risk clients (Client Health )



-Conduct weekly coaching and performance reviews to optimize marketer output



-Ensure compliance with agency SOPs, reporting templates, and automation workflows



-Identify bottlenecks and implement improvements to scale team and client performance



Qualifications:



-Experience in managing digital marketing teams or experience in project management



-Strong understanding of paid advertising campaigns, KPIs, and CPA metrics



-Experienced with project management tools 



-Highly analytical, process-driven, and a strong communicator



What We Offer:



Lead a high-performing team and shape scalable processes



Opportunity to manage client portfolios and drive measurable results



Professional growth in a structured, results-focused agency environment

title: Cold caller
description:
The job will pay you $2 plus $200 bonus for each closing( I close 4 properties per month). Then a performance bonus of at least $500 at the end of the year.



1 Lead Generation and Prospecting:

Identifying Potential Clients: Research and compile lists of prospective sellers, buyers, or investors using various databases and online resources.

Initial Outreach: Make outbound calls to introduce your services, gauge interest, and identify potential opportunities.



2. Script Development and Execution:

Script Utilization: Employ effective cold calling scripts tailored to different scenarios, such as initial contact with potential sellers or investors.

PIPEDRIVE

Adaptation: Modify scripts in real-time to address the specific needs and responses of each prospect, ensuring a personalized approach.



3. Qualifying Leads:

Information Gathering: Ask pertinent questions to assess the prospect's needs, property details, motivation to sell, and timeline.

Data Recording: Accurately document all relevant information in your CRM system for follow-up and analysis.



4. Appointment Setting:

Scheduling Meetings: Arrange appointments between interested prospects and you or your sales team to discuss opportunities further.

Calendar Management: Ensure all appointments are promptly added to shared calendars with necessary details.



5. Follow-Up Communication:

Maintaining Contact: Conduct follow-up calls or
s with prospects who have shown interest but have not yet committed, keeping them engaged.

Nurturing Leads: Provide additional information or answer questions to move prospects through the sales funnel.



6. Database Management:

CRM Updates: Regularly update the CRM with new leads, call notes, follow-up actions, and status changes.

Data Integrity: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records to ensure effective tracking and reporting.



7. Performance Reporting:

Activity Reports: Generate regular reports detailing call activities, outcomes, and key metrics such as the number of calls made, leads generated, and appointments set.

Feedback Provision: Offer insights and suggestions based on call experiences to improve scripts and strategies.



8. Continuous Improvement:

Skill Development: Stay updated on best practices in cold calling and real estate market trends to enhance effectiveness.

Script Refinement: Collaborate with you to refine calling scripts and strategies based on feedback and results.



9. Call to action: 

Send an
: If you have read and you are at the bottom of this, please send me an
 with your resume as well as apply on the website. Both actions are needed to be a valid applicant. Include job in the
.

title: Video Editor – DTC, UGC & E-Commerce
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Video Editor with deep experience in e-commerce (DTC), user-generated content (UGC), AI-assisted editing tools, and VSL-style direct response storytelling.

You will be responsible for concepting, editing, optimizing, and scaling high-performing video assets used across paid social platforms (Meta, TikTok), product pages,
 marketing, and broader brand initiatives.



Responsibilities



-Edit high-converting video ads tailored for DTC brands across TikTok, Meta, YouTube, and additional platforms.

-Build data-driven VSLs (Video Sales Letters) with strong hooks, compelling proof, effective pacing, and clear CTAs.

-Produce and assemble UGC-style ads, including raw voiceovers, testimonials, unboxings, green-screen clips, and reactions.

-Use AI tools (Adobe Firefly, Runway, Descript, Mid-journey, etc.) to accelerate editing, ideation, and asset generation.

-Create multiple variations for rapid A/B testing, including hooks, captions, CTAs, and format adjustments.

-Collaborate with marketing teams to ensure alignment with brand voice, messaging, and performance KPIs.

-Add motion graphics, captions, on-screen text, and dynamic transitions optimized for scroll-stopping effectiveness.

-Maintain organized project files, naming conventions, and asset libraries.

-Support content planning, script layout, and storyboard development.



Requirements



-2–4+ years of video editing experience, preferably in e-commerce or direct response marketing.

-Proven portfolio showcasing DTC ads, UGC content, and both long-form and short-form VSLs.

-Strong proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.

-Comfortable working with AI editing and asset-generation tools.

-Understanding of performance marketing and the elements that drive video conversions.

-Ability to transform raw footage into compelling storytelling with clean pacing and clear messaging.

-Fast, detail-oriented editor with an experimental, test-driven mindset.

-Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.



Bonus Skills



-Experience directing creators or UGC talent.

-Knowledge of e-commerce funnels, landing pages, and CRO principles.

-Thumbnail creation and graphic design familiarity.

-Audio mixing, light color correction, and sound design.

We work with clients in logistics, construction, healthcare and technical sectors. Our campaigns generate 10–30 qualified applicants per vacancy — fast and cost-effectively.

?

?

title: Sales Representative (WFH/Remote)
description:
*Do not apply if you do not have any previous outbound calling/sales experience.*



Outbound Telesales Representative



Above-market salary for top sales performers.

Work for the #1 Early Childhood Book Publisher in Australia, New Zealand and the UK!



What’s in it for you?

1. 10-40 hours of work per week with the option to get more hours depending on performance. We start you with 20 hours and we can gradually increase this.

2. Base rate of $8.00 AUD per hour. Depending on your experience + extra performance bonus.

3. You can work from home as long as you have a proper home office setup / good internet connection.

4. The opportunity to work in an amazing international team. You will be part of an organisation that works hard to improve the future of children by providing amazing educational materials.





What do we ask from you?

- Your exact working hours will be discussed. But will be Monday - Friday no weekends.

- You need to be available during UK school hours.

- We do not accept any applicants that have 2 or 3 other jobs already



Your tasks:

- Outbound Calls: you'll be contacting potential customers to sell our educational resources. You’ll be responsible for the whole process. From making initial contact, to closing the sale. After you closed the sale, our office will take over for the after sale support.

- Providing support to our managers and employees.

- Being in contact with management and our international teams in the UK, Australia and New Zealand.



Our Mission & Vision

Enlighten Press empowers children by getting our resources into every possible educational facility and home in the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, and around the world. We want to promote well being, awareness and possibility thinking in future generations through our leading-edge content for holistic learning.



See our website for more details about what we do: 



Requirements

- Experience with outbound calls. Comfortable and professional in phone conversations. You need to be able to be firm with customers and representatives but also friendly and personable.

- Minimum of 1 year of sales experience in a similar job

- You need to be tech-savvy as you’ll have to work with a lot of different software programs such as Google products (Google Drive, Sheets, Documents, Gmail).

- Very well mannered

- Being able to work independently.

- Excellent Fluency in English. And Great communication skills.

- Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask

- Proper home office setup

- You need to be persistent and determined to succeed. In this job you’ll have to deal with rejection and objections, as in any other sales job. You will succeed and earn a lot of money if you’re willing to work had and be persistent and consistent.



Include in your application your:

- Full name

- Phone number and
 address

- CV (provide a google drive link)

- Total duration of outbound sales experience (in years)

- The date you can start

- Recording (via Vocaroo) using the provided script below. Make sure you do it exactly how you would do it in your sales call. Tone of voice is important.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Script:



Hello (Name admin), may I speak to X (the director/manager) please? My name is (your name) from Enlighten Press.



*They might ask why you’re calling now*



We have some free educational resources for your centre that we want to speak with her about.



*Once they direct you to the manager*:



Good morning.

You’re speaking with (Your name) from Enlighten Press. We’re the people that make social and emotional books for small children.



The reason for my call is that we’re doing a special promotion through (a city that they’re in).

We’re giving away a free a3 size book about (Autism Spectrum Disorder / The world of My Emotions). Do you have any children with Autism in your centre?"



So, what we do is we post a catalogue and a free A3 size book to you. The book also comes with free curriculum notes. I just need to ask you a couple of questions:

- Do you have any printed books in your centre? Or is everything electronic? ?

- Does your centre have any budget for books? ?

- So you’re able to get the material that you need from time to time? ?

- And, I guess you’re in charge of all of that aren’t you?



Okay, that’s great. We’ll get that free book to you immediately.



Just confirming, your address is: XYZ Is that the best address to send it to?



We’ll send that book off. What I like to do after a couple of weeks, is I would like to just give you a ring and get your opinion about the book (Name).



So, what’s the best way to reach you (try to get phone number and
)?



Okay, thank you (Name) I’ll send that free book to you straight away.

title: Wellness Coach (Part-time)
description:
Passionate about people, mental wellness, and building meaningful team experiences? This role may be for you.

Do you enjoy creating safe spaces, facilitating meaningful conversations, and supporting teams in strengthening their emotional wellbeing and relationships? If you are energized by mental health advocacy, group dynamics, and people development, we would love to have you join our Wellness Team.



We are a fast-growing global design platform that believes great design begins with healthy, supported people. We are looking for a compassionate, proactive, and collaborative professional who can help design and facilitate impactful wellness sessions, team huddles, and culture-building initiatives in a creative and fast-paced environment.

 

What You Bring to the Table

• Licensed Psychologist or Guidance Counselor

• At least 2–3 years of experience in mental health, counseling, or people development roles

• Strong background in group facilitation, workshops, and psychoeducational sessions

• Ability to translate mental health concepts into practical, engaging, and relatable activities

• High emotional intelligence and strong professional maturity

• Excellent communication skills, with strong listening and reflection abilities

• Highly organized, dependable, and comfortable working with structure and timelines

• Collaborative mindset and ability to work closely with leadership and cross-functional teams

• Open to feedback, reflection, and continuous improvement

 

Key Responsibilities

• Facilitate regular wellness sessions and initiatives

• Lead team huddles and group dynamic activities

• Support preventive mental health efforts through education, early intervention, and referrals (within ethical scope)

• Observe team dynamics and identify emerging wellbeing needs or recurring patterns

• Collaborate with leadership and HR to align wellness programs with company culture and goals

• Document session data, insights, engagement levels, and recommendations for improvement

• Track participation and feedback to continuously refine wellness programs

• Partner closely with the Wellness Team Leader in planning, execution, and evaluation of initiatives

• Maintain confidentiality, ethical standards, and professional boundaries at all times

 

How to Apply

Apply through this form:

Please attach your resume and/or portfolio.

Learn more about us at penji.co.

title: Virtual Operations Coordinator (AU)
description:
KINDLY SEND YOUR RESUME IN A PDF FORMAT.



Role Purpose

The Virtual Assistant supports the day-to-day operations of Walkers Cleaning by handling administrative tasks, communication, scheduling, documentation, and follow-ups. The VA frees up the Founder and Operations Manager to focus on sales, growth, and high-level operations, while ensuring all internal processes run smoothly and nothing falls through the cracks.



Key Responsibilities

1. Operations Support

Monitor cleaner check-ins/check-outs inside 
 and flag anomalies (missing check-ins, early departures, etc.).

Assist with quality-control workflows, sending follow-ups, logging data, tracking trends.

Update recurring cleaning schedules, shifts, and site notes.

Prepare daily and weekly reports for the Founder and Operations Manager.



2. Client Communication

Respond to client
s professionally, quickly, and clearly.

Log client requests, issues, and feedback into 
.

Follow up with clients on satisfaction, service delivery, and consumables.

Draft and send service updates or notices when needed.



3. Staff & Site Onboarding

Prepare onboarding documents and send to new staff.

Assist with setting up new client sites: documentation, key management notes, checklists, and access details.

Maintain cleaner rosters and update staff profiles.



4. Admin & Documentation

Build, update, and maintain SOPs, checklists, WHS documents, and site manuals.

Create clean, Apple-style branded internal documents when needed.

Manage Google Drive structure and ensure all documents are organized and version-controlled.



5. Consumables & Stock Coordination

Track consumable usage per site and notify the Operations Manager when stock is low.

Maintain consumables spreadsheet and reconcile orders.

Send reminders to cleaners to perform stock counts.



6. Executive Assistance

Calendar management, meeting scheduling, and reminders.

Prepare summaries, briefs, and follow-up lists for key business tasks.

Conduct research (suppliers, competitors, tools, processes, etc.).



Skills & Requirements

-Strong written English and communication skills.

-Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive.

-Comfortable with 
, Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and basic task management tools.

-Ability to work independently, take initiative, and follow structured SOPs.

-Fast response times and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

-Experience working in a service-based business (preferred but not essential).

-Familiarity with cleaning industry operations or rosters is a bonus.



Benefits:

-Work from home

-Equipment provided

-13th-month pay

-Government benefits

-Vacation Leaves

-Sick Leaves

title: CX Rep for a Feminine Skincare Brand (FEMALE ONLY)
description:
About OYO Skincare



OYO is a modern intimate skincare brand built on one core belief: the most sensitive skin on the body deserves the same care, design, and intention as the rest of skincare. Founded by sisters Léonie and Lisa, OYO started with gentle, skin-first formulas and honest communication. Over time, the brand has grown into a category-defining hair removal and intimate care business, led by our hero product, Bye Bye Bush. Today, OYO is a focused, founder-led DTC brand with a clear product vision, strong customer loyalty, and high standards for how we build, market, and communicate.



About the Role



We’re hiring this role because our relationship with our customers matters deeply. As OYO grows, that relationship deserves more care, not less. This role exists to protect brand trust by making sure every interaction feels clear, timely, and genuinely supportive.



At its core, this role represents OYO wherever our customers meet us. You’re the voice behind the inbox, the calm presence in a DM, and the thoughtful reply when something goes wrong — or when something goes right. You’ll own customer conversations end-to-end, helping make things right when needed and reinforcing trust every step of the way.



You’ll sit within the customer experience team as an individual contributor, working closely with the Customer Experience Lead, operations, and fulfillment partners. While this isn’t a leadership role, it carries meaningful responsibility, visibility, and autonomy across the business.



What You’ll Do



- Own customer interactions across all platforms and marketplaces, including
, DMs, ad comments, Amazon, Trustpilot, website reviews, Reddit, and TikTok Shop.

- Ensure every customer message is acknowledged and resolved with care, clarity, and consistency.

- Guide customers post-purchase by answering questions, resolving issues, and supporting refunds, replacements, or order concerns.

- Maintain a warm, grounded, and on-brand voice that reflects OYO’s values at every touchpoint.

- Capture customer feedback, recurring issues, and patterns, and escalate insights or risks to the Customer Experience Lead.



Who You Are

- You’re comfortable taking ownership and seeing things through, even when the answer isn’t obvious at first.

- You care deeply about how people feel, not just whether a problem is technically “resolved.”

- You communicate clearly and kindly, with strong empathy and follow-through.

- You stay grounded under pressure and approach challenges with curiosity and care.



Tools & Setup



Required:

- Experience working with customer support platform

- Experience navigating Shopify on the CS end



Nice to have:

- Experience supporting an e-commerce or beauty brand

- Experience working with Amazon and TikTok Shop

- Familiarity with help centres, FAQs, or saved responses



Why Join OYO



OYO is a small, founder-led brand with:



- A clear product vision and hero SKU

- High ownership, low bureaucracy

- Real responsibility and impact from day one

- Long-term collaboration in mind, not short-term churn



You’ll be trusted to own your role, contribute meaningfully, and help shape how the brand evolves.



HOW TO APPLY



To apply:



-
 

- Subject line: [Role Title] – Your Name



Please include:



1. A short Loom video introducing yourself and why this role feels like a fit.

2. Examples of your work relevant to the role.



We only review applications that follow this process.



Thank you for your time — we’re excited to meet the right person.

title: t Writer (Remote – U.S. or International)
description:
Grant Writer (Remote – U.S. or International)



Position Type: Independent Contractor

Hours: Part-time (10–20 hours/week to start)

Pay: Competitive; based on experience and results

Location: Remote







About the Role



We are seeking an experienced Grant Writer with hands-on experience using Grants.gov and other platforms to support grant research, writing, submission, and compliance for U.S.-based education and community programs. This role requires accuracy, ethical grant practices, and strict attention to federal requirements.





Responsibilities

 • Research and identify federal, state, and private grant opportunities

 • Prepare and submit applications through Grants.gov

 • Write grant narratives, forms, and required attachments

 • Ensure compliance with federal grant requirements and deadlines

 • Track submissions, amendments, and reporting requirements

 • Maintain organized grant documentation and records

 • Collaborate on program descriptions and budgets







Required Qualifications

 • Demonstrated experience submitting grants through Grants.gov

 • Strong understanding of federal grant compliance and application structure

 • Proven grant-writing experience with verifiable work samples

 • Excellent research, writing, and editing skills

 • Ability to manage deadlines independently

 • High level of professionalism, accuracy, and integrity

 • Experience with education, childcare, or nonprofit grants preferred







Mandatory Hiring & Verification Requirements (No Exceptions)



All candidates must:

 1. Complete a written application

 2. Participate in a live video interview (camera on)

 3. Provide government-issued photo identification prior to onboarding

 4. Sign an Independent Contractor Agreement and Non-Disclosure Agreement

 5. Agree to ethical grant-writing standards (no plagiarism or misrepresentation)



Applicants who do not meet these requirements will not be considered.







How to Apply



Please submit:

 1. A brief cover letter describing your Grant Writing experience

 2. Resume

 3. Two grant-writing samples (redacted if needed)

 4. Answer the following question:

“Describe a grant you submitted through Grants.gov and your role in preparing and submitting the application.”



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.





Important Notes

 • No system access or paid work will begin until verification is complete

 • No text-only interviews

 • Contract role only

title: Squarespace Web Designer & Developer (Reusable Summit Pages)
description:
I am looking for a Squarespace web designer/developer to create a reusable summit framework for my education and leadership platform.

I host multiple online summits each year (e.g., Women’s Leadership Summit, Caregivers Summit) and need a clean, structured system that can be reused annually without rebuilding pages from scratch.

This is not a one-off landing page. The goal is a scalable, repeatable page structure that supports multiple summits over time.Scope of Work



1. Summit Hub Page

 • One main “Summits” page that introduces all current and future summits

 • Displays each summit as a card or section with:

 • Summit title

 • Short description

 • Date

 • Button linking to the individual summit page



This page must be reusable year after year.



?



2. Individual Summit Pages (2 initial builds)

Create two separate summit pages using the same reusable structure:

 • Women’s Leadership Voices Summit 2026

 • Caregivers Summit 2026



Each summit page should include:

 • Hero section with title, date, and short description

 • About the summit section

 • Speaker section (repeatable):

 • Speaker photo

 • Name

 • Bio

 • Session title

 • Presentation date & time

 • Agenda or schedule section

 • Call-to-action buttons linking to an external registration page (I will provide the links)



I will supply all text, speaker bios, photos, dates, and times.



?



3. Reusability & Ease of Use

The final setup must allow me to:

 • Duplicate a summit page for future years

 • Add, remove, or reorder speakers easily

 • Update text and images without code

 • Reuse the same structure for future summits



Please explain how the structure will be reused.





Platform Requirements

 • Squarespace (no migration to another platform)

 • Use standard pages and blocks (avoid overuse of Events Collection unless necessary)

 • Clean, professional, accessible design

 • Mobile responsive





Deliverables

 • 1 reusable Summit Hub page

 • 2 individual summit pages built from the same framework

 • Clear instructions or short walkthrough on how to duplicate and reuse pages



How to Apply



Please include:

 1. Examples of Squarespace sites you’ve built

 2. A brief explanation of how you would make this reusable

 3. Confirmation that I can update content without code

title: Legendary Operations Assistant
description:
A Legendary Operations Assistant Who Loves to Keep Things on Track



- Read our 7 core values here: 

- Take a look at the short 2-minute video below. This is who we are as a company and team: 



- Please apply on our careers page: 
/jobs/
operations-assistant



TL;DR (because attention spans are real):

We’re hiring a full-time remote Admin & Operations Assistant to help manage a wide range of backend and administrative tasks that keep our ecommerce business running smoothly. This role it’s about precision, diligence, and execution. You’ll work closely with our operations and finance teams to support internal trackers, manage reimbursements, check calculations, and assist with backend coordination. Your attention to detail and organizational skills will be essential in supporting smooth day-to-day operations and protecting the integrity of our systems.



Time zone: Full-time within Asia

Salary: USD
per month, depending on experience

Trial Period: All candidates will complete a paid trial assignment - more details below.



???? WHO WE ACTUALLY NEED (and who we don’t)

* This isn’t for freelancers moonlighting or wanting a side hustle.

* It’s not for someone who feels uncomfortable taking initiative, and who may need a lot of handholding.



This is however for someone who:

* Has at least 2 years of experience in any administrative or operations roles.

* Is tech-savvy, resourceful, and comfortable with online work.

* Has proficiency in data entry and database management.

* Have some experience with common eCommerce tools such as Slack, Google Drive, Asana, Shopify, Klaviyo, Zipify, etc. (Advantageous but not required)

* Is effective at verbal and written communication and following up is second nature to you.

* Is a self-starter, when given resources & training, can get things done without hand-holding.

* Has a natural sense of urgency. When things arise, you’re the first to tackle them.

* Is naturally detail-oriented and organized. Someone who has their desk and bedroom clean and neat.

* Thrives in a support role and always has a positive attitude.

* Is a learner at heart and is always working on self-development.



???? WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

* Review team reimbursement submissions, and track internal payments across platforms.

* Assist with administrative tasks related to inventory, platform uploads, internal reporting, and vendor coordination.

* Double-check numbers and simple calculations provided by teammates (you don’t need to be an accountant, just comfortable with Excel or Google Sheets).

* Maintain and update internal spreadsheets and trackers - making sure all data is current, consistent, and error-free.

* Help with ad hoc operational tasks as they arise - anything from submitting requests on platforms to ensure all records are complete and organized.



???? WHAT YOU GET

* Bonus Program - When we hit our company and individual objectives

* Fully remote with async flexibility

* Unlimited vacation and sick leave days

* Paid courses, coaching, and personal growth budget to help you level up

* We trust you to own your work and drive results



???? HOW WE HIRE

We believe in being clear and respectful of your time. Here’s exactly what to expect:



1. Application form: a few short questions and mini tasks to get a feel for your thinking.

2. HR Screening interview: This is a 30 - 45 minute interview to determine initial culture and role fit

3. Technical Interview: a 30 - 60-minute conversation with the hiring manager to dig deeper into your experience, mindset, and fit.

4. Paid test assignment: a realistic task (2–3 days to complete) that reflects the kind of work you’d actually do here.

5. Final Interview: Usually with our CEO, as a final seal of approval

6. Reference calls

7. Offer + onboarding: if it’s a match, we move quickly



No ghosting.

No five-round interview circus.

Just a fair, focused process designed to find the right fit for both sides.

Application Instructions (IMPORTANT):

- Product link

title: Data -
description:
Job Description

I am looking for a Market Research Analyst who genuinely enjoys "finding the needle in the haystack." This is not a mindless data-entry role. I need a critical thinker who can look at a spreadsheet, look at a map, and tell a story.

If you are someone who likes solving puzzles and "reading between the lines" of data, you will thrive here.

The Role



Your job is to identify high-probability investment pockets using our proprietary multi-step filtration system. You will be moving from broad macro data sets down to surgical, local market validation. We find the "Sleeper Markets" that everyone else misses.



What You’ll Do

Quantitative Screening: Use specialized data platforms to identify markets that meet our specific benchmarks.

Qualitative Validation: "Put eyes on the ground" via the MLS to verify if the data matches reality.

Investigative Analysis: You are responsible for making a hypothesis. Don't just report the numbers, explain why a market looks a certain way.

Monday.com Reporting: Maintain a clean, high-level board of candidate markets for our acquisitions team.



Who You Are (The Detective)

The "Why" Thinker: You aren’t satisfied with a "Median Price." You want to know why one property sold in 10 days and another sold in 200. You seek to understand the story behind the data.



The Real Estate Pro: You understand that land value is driven by more than just location—you understand how topography, listing quality, and buyer "views/saves" signal a hot market.



Pattern Recognizer: You can spot the "Heartbeat" reading between the lines

Who You Are NOT (The Clerk)



A Button-Clicker: If you want to follow a checklist blindly without thinking, please do not apply.



AI-Reliant: We use tech, but we win because of human intuition. If you let a software "score" make the final call without verifying it, you’ll miss the gold.



About Me

My name is Zach. I run a highly focused and intentional land acquisitions business. I’m looking for a market analyst with a critical eye, not just a task-runner.

I live in metro Detroit. Go Lions!

I’m usually outside hiking with my dog, enjoying the Great Lakes, or at the gym.

A little tenant I have is Movement, Music, Mindset! If you value growth and intentionality, we will get along great.



How to Apply

Please put the number 909 and the current temperature in your city at the very top of your response.

Selection Process: 

1. Initial application review. 

2. Interview

3. A $50 Paid Trial Day for the top 2 finalists (includes 2 hours of training and a live market hunt).

title: Social Media & Marketing Manager
description:
Podcast Summit is looking for a Social Media & Marketing Manager to help grow our brand, audience, and ticket sales within the podcasting space.



This is not a basic posting role. We’re looking for someone who understands how social media drives attention ? leads ? conversions, and who can both develop the strategy and execute the content to support it.



What This Role Looks Like



As the Social Media & Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for owning Podcast Summit’s online presence and growth strategy, including:



> Developing and executing an overall social media and marketing strategy to grow brand awareness, engagement, and ticket sales

> Creating and publishing 2 high-quality pieces of content per day across platforms

> Curating and posting engaging clips from relevant podcasts and creators in the podcasting space

> Creating educational content (facts, stats, trends, and insights) that highlights the importance of podcasting in today’s culture, personally and professionally

> Repurposing content from previous Podcast Summit conferences, including:

    > Keynotes

    > Panels

    > Fireside chats

    > Recaps, highlight clips, and promotional assets

> Developing and executing a lead capture strategy 
 signups, funnels, CTAs, etc.)

> Creating and managing paid ads to support audience growth and ticket sales



Tracking, measuring, and reporting on:

  > Audience growth

  > Engagement

  > Lead performance

  > Conversions and ticket sales



This Role Is NOT For Someone Who:

- Only knows how to “post content” without a strategy

- Needs to be told exactly what to create every day

- Doesn’t understand how social media connects to business goals

- Can’t balance creativity with analytics



This Role Is For You If You:

-Understand podcast culture and the creator economy

- Know how to turn content into attention ? leads ? conversions

- Are confident creating content that is clean, creative, and visually appealing

- Can think strategically and execute hands-on

- Are comfortable owning both strategy and content creation

- Care about aesthetics and performance metrics



Content Examples We’re Looking For

    > Podcast education, facts, and statistics that emphasize why podcasting matters today

    > Clips and highlights from previous Podcast Summit keynotes and sessions. 

    > Short-form content that builds authority, drives engagement, and pushes audiences toward purchasing a Podcast Summit ticket.

    > Creative recaps, promotional clips, and evergreen assets built from past conference footage



Bonus Points If You:

- Have experience marketing events, conferences, or live experiences

- Have worked in podcasting, media, or creator-led brands

- Can show examples of accounts you’ve grown or campaigns you’ve led

title: Executive Assistant (Project & Delivery)
description:
Pathway to Chief of Staff

reports to: Founder/ CEO

time commitment: 20 hours per week



Role overview: 



This is not a traditional Executive Assistant role.

You will act as the Founder’s execution partner — ensuring projects move forward, commitments are honoured, and nothing stalls due to lack of follow-up, structure, or clarity.

The Founder initiates. You close the loop.

Your focus is simple and demanding:

Every active project has a clear status, a next step, and an accountable owner — without the Founder having to ask.

This role is designed to evolve into a Chief of Staff position for the right person.

Core Responsibilities



Project Follow-Through & Delivery

Track 5–10 active projects across technology, consulting, insurance, and business initiatives

Maintain clear project status updates, timelines, and next actions

Proactively follow up with developers, consultants, and external vendors to keep work moving

Surface risks, delays, or gaps early — with proposed solutions, not just problems



Executive Support (High-Impact)

Draft and manage high-polish, brand-aligned communication on behalf of the Founder

Prepare summaries, briefs, and follow-ups after meetings and discussions

Ensure commitments made by or to the Founder are documented and actioned



External Coordination

Act as the Founder’s point of contact with:

Tech developers

Consultants

Insurance and professional service providers

Schedule and coordinate meetings with purpose, agendas, and outcomes — not just calendars



Visibility & Reporting

Maintain a live view of all active initiatives

Provide weekly execution reviews covering:

What moved forward

What is blocked

What needs Founder input

What is coming next



Authority & Access

Full access to business systems, project documentation, compliance material, and sensitive information

Represents the Founder externally with professionalism and clarity

Internal authority is through the Founder — this role enables, not overrides

Discretion and confidentiality are non-negotiable.

What Success Looks Like



After 90 days, success means:



The Founder never has to ask for a project status update

Every initiative has a clear owner, deadline, and next step

External partners respond quickly because expectations are clear and consistently enforced

Communication going out in the Founder’s name reflects a high professional standard



Ideal Background



Former Executive Assistant to a CEO or Founder

Strong project coordination or delivery experience

Comfortable working with senior professionals, developers, and external vendors

Experience operating in fast-moving, multi-project environments



Required Traits



Relentless follow-through

Clear, professional written communication

Calm under pressure

High personal standards

Comfortable handling confidential and sensitive information

Willing to speak up when something is at risk — and propose solutions

Tools & Working Style

Comfortable working in Microsoft Teams and
-based environments

Able to work asynchronously, with structured weekly reviews

Overlap with Australian business hours is required



Growth Path



This role is intended to develop into a Chief of Staff position, with increased responsibility across operations, execution, and strategic coordination for the Founder.

Why This Role Exists

This role exists to protect the Founder’s time and attention — not by managing an inbox, but by ensuring ideas turn into delivered outcomes.



You will need to: 



copy of your resume to be sent (as a dropbox, google drive link) 

List your salary expectations clearly in the message

Not say "hire me" cliche words

Only profile which is suitable and matches the resume will be considered.
