title: Joinery Draftsperson/Joinery CAD Technician
description:
Company Overview



We’re a small group of big thinkers working together like a well-oiled machine.

We would much rather work with a few exceptional individuals than a lot of average people.



A little bit about our company:

We’re based in Sydney, NSW and have been operating since 2000. We specialise in commercial shopfitting, delivering retail, hospitality, medical, and commercial tenancies within shopping centres and standalone sites.



Our work covers the full journey - from shell & core tenancies through to fully operational turnkey spaces. Joinery is a core strength of our business, with in-house joinery capabilities and our own factory, and this role is critical in bridging architectural intent with real-world fabrication and installation.



Job Summary



The Joinery Draftsperson / Joinery CAD Technician plays a critical role within our joinery and pre-construction team. This position is responsible for translating architectural drawings and design intent into fully detailed, fabrication-ready joinery shop drawings for production and installation.



The role requires strong technical understanding of joinery construction, materials, fixing methods, and coordination with services. You will work closely with our Project Managers, Estimator, and Joinery Manager to ensure all drawings are accurate, buildable, and aligned with project requirements.



This is a technical drafting role, not a design or conceptual position.



Key Responsibilities

Joinery Drafting & Documentation



Review architectural drawings, specifications, and design information and transfer all relevant details into joinery production drawings.



Produce a full joinery drawing package, including:



Plans, elevations, and sections



Fully detailed dimensions in millimetres (mm)



Set-out dimensions and relevant datum references



Internal carcass layouts and construction details



3D views / isometrics from multiple angles for clarity



Joinery construction and joint details (mitres, rebates, edging, shadow lines, etc.)



Fixing and installation details (wall, floor, ceiling fixing methods, brackets, cleats, etc.)



Services Coordination



Coordinate joinery drawings with required services and allow for:



Electrical provisions (GPOs, data, lighting allowances)



Plumbing provisions (sink, waste, water points where applicable)



Ventilation openings where required



Ensure all service cut-outs and allowances are clearly documented and coordinated.



Hardware & Materials



Recommend and document joinery hardware and fittings, including:



Hinges, drawer runners, handles, locks



Soft-close systems, magnetic catches, specialty hardware



Prepare materials take-offs and board quantity estimates, including sheet breakdowns where applicable.



Document and confirm:



Board thickness and material types (melamine, MDF, veneer, laminate, 2PAC, etc.)



Edge details (ABS edging, timber edging)



Finish schedules and colour codes as per architect or designer selections



File Outputs



Issue joinery production drawings in PDF format for review and approval.



Export drawing files in CAD format (DWG preferred) suitable for factory use.



Administrative & Coordination Support



Maintain organised digital job folders and drawing registers.



Revise drawings based on internal review, client feedback, or site conditions.

Proactive mindset - identifying issues before they become problems.



Qualifications & Experience



Background in Joinery Drafting, Architecture, Interior Fitout, or Construction Drafting.



Prior experience producing fabrication-ready joinery shop drawings is essential.



Experience working with commercial fitouts or joinery factories is highly regarded.



Work Environment

Fast-paced environment with multiple live projects.



Part of a supportive virtual team with regular online meetings and clear communication channels.

Benefits

Long-term role with stable workflow for the right candidate.



Application Process

As part of your application, you must submit examples of previous joinery drafting work.

Applications without joinery shop drawing examples will not be reviewed.

Academic qualifications or transcripts (if applicable)

References



Required Tests

/



Submit Your Application



 your application to

Review & Selection Process

title: Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) Specialist
description:
Green Bay Remodeling is looking for a Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) Specialist to lead our visibility and growth across AI-driven search platforms. What You’ll Do:

• Develop and execute GEO strategies to make Green Bay Remodeling rank prominently in AI and LLM-powered search results.

• Create optimized prompts, structured data, and content that improve how AI systems interpret and recommend our brand.

• Analyze query and conversion data to drive qualified website visits and appointment bookings.

• Collaborate with marketing, content, and web teams to align GEO initiatives with campaign goals.

• Report on tangible outcomes—bookings, leads, and sales—not just impressions or clicks.

• Stay ahead of generative search trends and evolving AI search behavior.



What You Bring:

• Proven analytical and technical mindset with strong writing and strategic skills.

• Understanding of SEO fundamentals

• Exceptional collaboration skills—an adaptable team player who can also work independently.

• Strong communication, openness to feedback, and a performance-driven approach.



If you’re passionate about shaping how brands show up in the next generation of AI search and can deliver measurable results, we’d love to meet you.

title: Interactive Real Estate Leadership Book
description:
We are seeking an exceptional ghostwriter to transform a powerful personal narrative into a market-shifting, interactive workbook. This is not just a book—it’s a credibility engine, a recruitment tool, and a self-discovery model for real estate professionals and investors. The core story follows the author's journey from building a $13M portfolio to losing it all through betrayal, and ultimately rebuilding a new empire with a transformative ecosystem.



If you can write with the direct, cinematic, and relentlessly useful voice of a battle-tested mentor—think *The 4-Hour Workweek* meets a real estate field manual—this project is for you.



The Core Assignment:

You will remaster 4 existing chapters and write 10 new chapters to create one cohesive, compelling manuscript. The final book must:



Blend raw storytelling with actionable frameworks.



Function as an interactive workbook with exercises, audits, and challenges in every chapter.



Seamlessly integrate the author’s ecosystem (Turn Key Realty Portfolio & Alkebulan REIT) as the logical next step for readers.



Maintain a consistent voice: conversational, direct, vulnerable, and authoritative.



You Are the Ideal Candidate If You:

Have ghostwritten or authored books in the business/self-development space, particularly interactive or workbook-style titles.



Can adopt and sustain a strong, personal voice that blends storytelling with tactical instruction.



Understand (or can quickly learn) real estate development, investing, and entrepreneurship themes.



Are comfortable weaving in unconventional themes (e.g., astrology, legacy, spiritual alignment) alongside hard business strategy.



Can work within a structured content framework while bringing creativity and depth to each chapter.



Meet deadlines and communicate proactively.



Scope of Work:

Edit & polish 4 existing chapters (provided), ensuring they align with the final voice and workbook format.



Write 10 new chapters from outlines/titles, ensuring they are seamlessly integrated with the core story and themes.



Incorporate key concepts from source material: sovereignty, resilience, trust, legacy, and ecosystem collaboration.



Embed interactive workbook sections at the end of each chapter—including pointed questions, concrete experiments, and strategic calls-to-action.



Incorporate excerpts and themes from the core chapters throughout the book to reinforce narrative continuity.



Key Themes to Master:

From collapse to resilience



Sovereignty vs. dependency



Building trust as competitive advantage



Legacy over liquidity



Community-centered real estate development



Aligning business with purpose



Deliverables & Timeline:

Full manuscript (14 chapters + introduction)



Interactive workbook elements in every chapter



Timeline: 3–4 weeks for first draft, with milestone-based deliveries (e.g., 4 chapters/week for review)



Format: Google Doc or Word, clearly structured with headings, exercises, and CTAs



Budget:

$400–$500, paid in milestones tied to chapter deliverables.



To Apply:

Please submit the following:



Your resume or LinkedIn profile highlighting relevant ghostwriting or authorship experience.



2–3 writing samples that demonstrate your ability to write in a conversational, action-oriented voice (preferably business, real estate, or self-development).



A brief note explaining why you’re drawn to this project and how you’d approach blending story with workbook-style interactivity.



Your availability to start and estimated timeline.



Application Deadline:

Saturday February 7 2025



We’re not just writing a book—we’re building a movement. If you’re ready to help translate a story of loss, learning, and legacy into a tool that changes careers, we want to hear from you.



Submit your application to: [Your
 Address]

title: Graphic Designer/Print on Demand Assistant
description:

Position: Graphic Designer & Administrative Tasks

Hours: 6–8 hours per day

Pay:

$5/hour for the first 4 weeks

$6/hour starting Month 2 if desired output is met

Performance-based bonuses available

Long-term role for the right candidate



About the Role

We are looking for a highly skilled graphic designer to support a growing Print on Demand business. This role is focused on creating designs that sell, not just designing for fun.

You will be responsible for researching popular design topics, creating original designs using Canva and/or Kittl, and uploading finished products into Printify. This is not a short-term gig — I am looking for someone who wants to grow long-term with one company.



Responsibilities

-Research trending and high-demand design topics 

-Create original, on-trend designs for Print on Demand products

-Use Canva (required) and/or Kittl to create designs

-Upload finished products accurately into Printify

-Organize design files and product listings efficiently

-Meet daily and weekly design output expectations

-Implement feedback and continuously improve design quality



Required Skills & Experience

? Advanced Canva experience (required)

? Ability to research Etsy and identify trending topics

? Self-starter who can work independently

? Highly organized and detail-oriented

? Able to learn quickly and apply feedback

? Reliable, consistent, and professional

? Impeccable references



Preferred (Not Required)

? Familiarity with Printify

? Experience with Kittl

? Understanding of Print on Demand best practices



Compensation, Bonuses & Growth

-Starting rate of $5/hour for the first 4 weeks

-Increase to $6/hour starting Month 2 if output and quality expectations are met

-Performance bonuses available for exceeding design and productivity goals

-Long-term opportunity for the right candidate who consistently delivers strong results



How to Apply (Required)

To be considered, please include all of the following:

-A brief description of your experience using Canva

A short explanation of why you believe this design would perform well on the platform

Final Notes

Is motivated by performance-based growth and bonuses

If this sounds like a good fit, I look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Sales-Led General Manager (Remote | Night Shift / US Hours)
description:
We are a fast-growing, remote-first interior design and renovation coordination business serving U.S.-based residential and commercial clients (primarily NYC, Los Angeles and San Francisco). Our team supports home renovations and office fit-outs. We are hiring a Sales-Led General Manager to own revenue, team execution, and operational performance.



This is a leadership role for someone who can close deals, drive accountability, and run the day-to-day engine of the business. You will be responsible for both sales outcomes and operational delivery. This role requires strong English, comfort with U.S. clients, and the ability to work night hours aligned with EST.



You will lead discovery, qualification, and closing calls with U.S. clients, follow up proactively, maintain a clean pipeline in our CRM, and consistently hit revenue targets. You will manage workload and capacity across a remote design team, assign projects, track delivery, coach on quality and client communication, and resolve issues end-to-end. You will improve workflows, pricing, and service structure, identify inefficiencies, and help build repeatable systems so growth does not break operations. You will also act as a senior escalation point for client concerns and ensure a high-quality client experience from first contact through handoff to execution.



We are looking for someone with at least 8-10 years of experience across sales, operations, and team leadership, with direct experience working with U.S.-based clients. You should have background in at least one of the following: interior design, home renovations or construction, real estate services, office furnishings or commercial fit-outs, or a tech-enabled services business. You must be fluent in professional English (spoken and written), confident on calls, and comfortable pushing for decisions and holding others accountable.



This role is fully remote but requires a strong technical setup. You must have a reliable high-speed internet connection (minimum 50 Mbps) with a backup connection, a quiet professional workspace, and the ability to take frequent Zoom or phone calls with U.S. clients. You must be comfortable working night shift hours to support U.S. time zones.



Compensation includes a competitive base salary plus performance-based bonuses tied to revenue and operational KPIs, with strong upside for high performers. Likely $1,150 to $1,400 base, plus commissions. May start off part-time to gauge team fit.



How to apply: Do not reach out via our website. Please send a link to a cloud-based folder (Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.) that includes:



1. A voice recording of you reading your cover letter



2. Your resume



3. A short written cover letter explaining why you are a fit for this role, your experience with U.S. clients and sales/operations leadership, and your availability for night shift



Applications missing any of the above will not be considered.

title: Full-Time Marketing, Content & Automation Virtual Assistant
description:
Job Title



Full-Time Marketing, Content & Automation Virtual Assistant



About the Role



We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented full-time Marketing & Automation Virtual Assistant to support the day-to-day execution of marketing, content, and systems for a busy nightlife and events brand in Australia.



This role focuses on execution, organisation, and system implementation, not marketing strategy or paid advertising. You will work from clear briefs, templates, and documented processes provided by our marketing team.



This is a long-term role suited to someone who enjoys structured work, systems, and supporting creative and marketing operations.



Key Responsibilities

Social Media & Content Support



Editing short-form videos (Reels, TikToks, Shorts)



Cutting long videos into multiple short clips



Adding captions, subtitles, and basic effects



Creating simple graphics for posts and stories



Formatting content for different platforms



Scheduling posts using provided tools



Content & Asset Management



Organising photos and videos in Google Drive



Naming, tagging, and sorting content files



Maintaining content calendars and trackers



Tracking what content has been posted and when



Managing approved vs draft content



Marketing & Campaign Support



Preparing content assets for upcoming events



Updating promotional schedules



Assisting with campaign preparation (no ads management)



Preparing WhatsApp, SMS, or
 drafts from provided copy



Go High Level (GHL) CRM Support



Working inside Go High Level to support CRM operations



Building and updating workflows and automations from provided logic



Creating and managing tags, pipelines, and basic automations



Uploading contacts and maintaining CRM hygiene



Supporting messaging workflows (setup only, not copywriting)



ClickUp Workflow & Automation Support



Building and maintaining ClickUp task structures



Creating task templates and checklists



Setting up automations and workflows in ClickUp



Maintaining documentation of processes



Keeping task boards organised and up to date



Reporting & Admin Support



Updating reporting spreadsheets



Pulling basic metrics from social platforms and CRM



Monitoring Google reviews and feedback



Flagging issues or opportunities to the team



Tools You’ll Use



ClickUp (task management and automations)



Go High Level (CRM and workflows)



Google Drive, Docs & Sheets



Canva



CapCut or similar video editing tools



Training and documentation will be provided.



What We’re Looking For



Experience using Go High Level (CRM, workflows, automations)



Experience using ClickUp, including automations and templates



Strong attention to detail and organisation



Comfortable following systems and instructions



Reliable and consistent with deadlines



Good written English communication



You do not need to:



Create marketing strategy



Manage paid ads



Write long-form copy



Working Hours & Pay



Full-time role



Some overlap with Australian business hours preferred



Salary: $1,200 AUD per month



Long-term opportunity for the right person



How to Apply (Important)



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Your experience with Go High Level and what you’ve built in it



Your experience with ClickUp (workflows, automations, templates)



Examples of video editing or content work (if available)



Your internet speed and equipment setup



To confirm you’ve read this job description, please include the word “FREQUENCY” in the first line of your application.



Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be considered.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
React / n8n / Supabase — Contract Role

And Studio + LIVE AI

About the Role

We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to help build AI-powered SaaS platforms and web applications for small businesses and churches. You'll work across multiple projects—from restaurant management tools to AI knowledge bases to coaching platforms. If you enjoy variety, owning features end-to-end, and working with a small team that ships fast, this could be a great fit.



What You'll Work On

Building responsive React/Next.js interfaces with TypeScript

Creating backend workflows and API integrations using n8n

Working with Supabase (PostgreSQL, Auth, Edge Functions, Row-Level Security)

Implementing multi-tenant SaaS architecture patterns

Integrating third-party APIs (Square, Stripe, AI/LLM services)

Shipping features from database schema to polished UI



Tech Stack

Frontend: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS

Backend: Supabase (PostgreSQL, Auth, Storage, Edge Functions)

Automation: n8n for workflow orchestration and API routes

Integrations: Square, Stripe, AI/LLM APIs

Tools: GitHub, ClickUp, Vercel



Requirements

2+ years experience with React/Next.js and TypeScript

Solid understanding of PostgreSQL and relational database design

Experience with Supabase, Firebase, or similar BaaS platforms

Comfortable working across the full stack (frontend and backend)

Strong communication skills and ability to work async with a distributed team

Self-directed with good judgment on when to ask for help



Nice to Have

Experience with n8n or similar workflow automation tools

Familiarity with AI/LLM integrations (RAG, embeddings, vector search)

Multi-tenant SaaS architecture experience

Background in church tech, ministry tools, or faith-based organizations

Experience with Square, Stripe, or POS integrations



About Us

And Studio is a fast-growing digital agency and AI SaaS company, founded in 2014 with the vision of embracing possibilities and big dreams. Our name reflects our philosophy: we are all about "Yes AND Both."

Our core values are rooted in Christian principles:

Start Small, Dream Big: We believe in the power of small beginnings leading to great achievements.

Living
 We value integrity and authenticity in every aspect of life.

Prioritize People Over Projects: We cherish people and their contributions above all else.

Make it Count: We focus on what truly matters.

Find a Way & TEA (Test Every Assumption): We believe in persistence and continuous improvement.

Unity, Speed, Ownership, Passion, Grace/Flexibility, Generosity



Engagement Details

Contract role: 35-40 hours/week

Remote — async-friendly with some overlap for standups

Competitive rate based on experience

Potential for bonuses, raises, and long-term engagement



How to Apply



Send your application with:

Subject line: "I Want to Work at And Studio - Full Stack Developer - [Your Full Name]"

Brief intro (2-3 sentences max): Why you want this position and why you're a good fit. Keep it concise—longer introductions will be skipped.

Link to GitHub or portfolio showing relevant work

Your availability (hours/week, timezone)

Hourly rate expectations

Short intro video about you and your experience

 to: 
 & 

If selected, a short Google Meet video call will be required.

title: Brand/Logo Designer & Brand Strategist
description:
Brand Strategist & Designer



We are on the lookout for a talented Brand Strategist & Designer with a strong ability to think strategically and execute visually. If you have a passion for building brands from the ground up—combining positioning, messaging, and design into cohesive systems—we’d love to meet you! Please share samples of your work by including either a portfolio or links to live brand, design, or web projects with your application.



Responsibilities:



Develop brand strategies including positioning, messaging frameworks, and brand narratives.



Translate brand strategy into visual identity systems (logos, color palettes, typography, visual language).



Design brand and marketing assets for digital platforms (websites, landing pages, presentations, social media).



Collaborate with internal teams to ensure strategic and visual consistency across all touchpoints.



Support project management efforts and ensure timely delivery of brand and design projects.



Present brand concepts and design directions clearly to internal teams and clients.



Requirements:



Proven experience as a Brand Strategist, Brand Designer, or similar hybrid role with at least three years of work experience.



Strong portfolio demonstrating both strategic thinking and high-quality design execution.



Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or equivalent design tools.



Strong understanding of branding, visual systems, and storytelling.



Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.



Keen attention to detail.



Strong design and front-end visual sensibility.



Familiarity with web design, UI/UX principles, and digital-first branding is a plus.



Experience working with startups, agencies, or purpose-driven organizations is a plus.



Strong project management skills and the ability to work as part of a team.



About Us:



We are a fast-growing and innovative company, founded on the principle of bridging the gap between businesses and their customers. And Studio was established in 2014 with the vision of embracing possibilities and big dreams. Our name reflects our philosophy: we are all about “Yes AND Both.”



Our core values are rooted in Christian principles:



Start Small, Dream Big: We believe in the power of small beginnings leading to great achievements.



Living
 We value integrity and authenticity in every aspect of life.



Prioritize People Over Projects: We cherish people and their contributions above all else.



Make it Count: We focus on what truly matters.



Find a Way & TEA (Test Every Assumption): We believe in persistence and continuous improvement.



Unity, Speed, Ownership, Passion, Grace/Flexibility, Generosity



We are looking for someone who is excited about being part of a project from start to finish and who can bring strong strategic thinking and project ownership to our team. If our values resonate with you and you’re looking for a long-term collaboration, we would love to hear from you!



Application Instructions:



Change the subject line to:

“I Want to Work at And Studio – Brand Strategist & Designer – [Your Full Name Here]”



Start your message with 2–3 sentences on why you would like this position and why you are a good fit. Keep it concise; applications with longer introductions will be deleted.



Send an intro video about you and your experience via
 to our Operations Director:





We are offering a fantastic job opportunity with potential for bonuses and raises. Only applicants who follow these instructions will be considered. If selected, a short Google Video Meet call with video will be required.



Thank you,

And Studio



Note: A potential opportunity for a full-time role will be offered to accepted applicants, based on project performance.

title: Creative Support Specialist (Quality Assurance Focus)
description:
Monday–Friday | 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM (PHT)

100% Remote | Open to Filipino Applicants Only



About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and objective Creative Support Specialist to help uphold and protect our design quality standards. This role goes beyond design execution—you will evaluate creative output and assess why projects succeed or fall short.

As a quality auditor for our creative team, you will review completed projects that received neutral or negative feedback, identify root causes, and provide objective findings. Your insights will help reduce revision cycles, strengthen brand compliance, and support leadership in coaching and improving designer performance.

If you have a strong foundation in graphic design and enjoy quality control, process improvement, and problem-solving, this role may be an excellent fit.

 

Key Responsibilities

• Quality Audits: Review completed design projects—particularly those with neutral/negative feedback or cancellations—to assess alignment with client briefs, brand guidelines, and design fundamentals.

• Root Cause Analysis: Evaluate client feedback and comments to determine the primary issues (e.g., misinterpretation of brief, execution concerns, communication gaps) and document findings objectively.

• Pattern Identification: Track recurring errors or performance trends across designers and project types.

• Performance Reporting: Maintain quality documentation and report consistent underperformance or repeated quality concerns to Team Leaders and HR for appropriate action.

• Continuous Improvement: Provide actionable insights and data to leadership to improve training, reduce revisions, and enhance overall client satisfaction.

 

Qualifications

•  Design Expertise: Strong knowledge of graphic design fundamentals, including layout, typography, color theory, and branding.

• Analytical Thinking: Ability to distinguish personal preference from objective design issues and convert feedback into clear, actionable points.

• QA / Art Direction Experience: Background in reviewing creative work, quality control, style guides, or art direction is highly preferred.

• Objective Communication: Comfortable providing factual, constructive feedback and reporting performance concerns without bias.



Tech Requirements

• Reliable computer capable of running design software (for reviewing source files)

• Stable internet connection

• 720p (or higher) webcam and working headset/microphone

 

Perks & Benefits

• Recognition programs (e.g., Designer of the Month and performance incentives)

• Supportive and collaborative remote culture

• Career growth opportunities and advancement pathways

• Flexible remote setup

• Paid maternity and paternity leave

• Monthly competitions and creative challenges

• Long-term stability with ongoing opportunities

• Paid time off (monthly vacation accrual)

• Wellness support and mental health resources

• Learning and development opportunities (training, mentorship, etc.)

 

Bonus Points If You:

• Have experience using project management tools for ticket tracking and history review

• Have a background in both Graphic Design and Customer Support/Success

• Are data-driven and comfortable creating simple quality trend reports

 

How to Apply (To Help Your Application Stand Out)

1. Complete the application form: 
]

2. For the question “Please type the magic phrase,” enter: qualitymatters

3. Attach your portfolio (to demonstrate design knowledge) and resume highlighting QA/review experience

title: Short-Term Rental Operations Manager (Airbnb)
description:
We run a portfolio of short-term rental properties in the US. We're looking for someone who can own the day-to-day operations. Not just follow instructions, but think, solve problems, and make decisions without being told what to do.

This is not a task-execution role. We need someone who can manage guest communications, coordinate maintenance, handle escalations, and keep everything running smoothly while we focus on growth.



What You'll Do:



Respond to all guest messages quickly and professionally. Coordinate with cleaners and maintenance. Follow up until it's done, don't just send a message and hope. Handle guest issues using good judgment, including refund decisions and resolving bad experiences. Fight Airbnb disputes and process damage claims. Manage and oversee other tea
mbers. Spot problems before they become emergencies. Take initiative. If something's broken, fix it or figure out how.



Nice to haves: clickUp or related project management tool experience. Operational expertise. Leadership experience. Previous Airbnb jobs 



Who You Are:

You think fast and don't need to be told the same thing twice. You can make decisions without asking for permission on every little thing. You write clearly and professionally in English. You treat this like your own business, not just a job.

Experience in short-term rentals, property management, or hospitality is a plus. If you've worked at Airbnb support or know how to navigate AirCover, file claims, and win disputes, that's a bonus. Familiarity with ClickUp or similar project management tools is a plus. But what matters most is how you think, not where you've worked.





Compensation:

Up to $1,200 per month based on experience. Performance bonuses available for response time, guest reviews, and successful Airbnb claims. This is a full-time role with real growth potential for the right person.



To Apply:



Send your resume and a Loom video (3-5 minutes) answering the following scenario:



"It's 2 PM on a Friday. Here's your situation:

The Maple Street property is a 4-bedroom house. There's a guest checking in at 4 PM with a total reservation of $1,800. Your cleaner Maria just texted that her car broke down and she can't make it. The unit hasn't been cleaned.



At the River House, a 2-bedroom condo, a guest named Marcus checked in this morning. His total reservation is $260. He sends photos showing hair in the bathroom and dusty surfaces. He's frustrated.



At the Elm Court property, a 3-bedroom house, you have a guest checking in at 4 PM with a total reservation of $950. The previous guest reported the heat isn't working when they left this morning. It's 20 degrees outside. You called your HVAC tech and the earliest he can come is 6 PM.



Walk me through your next few hours. How do you prioritize? What do you do about the cleaning emergency? How do you handle Marcus? What do you do about the Elm Court guest who's going to show up to a freezing house two hours before the tech arrives?



I'm not looking for textbook answers. I want to see how you think, how you solve problems when the normal options don't work, and whether you'd take initiative to find solutions on your own."



Applications without a Loom video will not be considered.

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
Let’s be real...

You’re the sharpest SEO mind in the room, but you’re bored. You’ve mastered the tools, you’ve memorized the algorithms, and you’re tired of playing "small ball." You don't just want to rank keywords; you want to dominate markets and eventually lead the entire operation.

We are not looking for a "worker." We are looking for a future leader.





The Mission

At our agency, we don’t "do SEO." 







We build digital empires. 







We’ve hit 50+ clients in a year and are now on a warpath to 10x our revenue. 







To do that, we need an SEO Architect—someone who uses AI as a weapon, not a crutch, and who views a Google penalty or "shadow ban" as a puzzle to be solved, not a reason to panic.





Who You Are (The Commander’s Profile)

The AI Alchemist: You don’t just "use" ChatGPT. You engineer complex prompts and custom GPTs to automate audits, map user intent, and predict SERP shifts. You are obsessed with finding the $1+1=10$ efficiency in AI workflows.





The Crisis Specialist: When a site gets "shadow banned" or tanked by a Core Update, you don't send a "wait and see"
. You move into the war room, dismantle the site’s authority signals, identify the "helpful content" mismatch, and execute a surgical recovery plan.





The Growth Obsessive: You pursue Mastery, Autonomy, and Purpose. You aren't looking for a "comfortable" job; you’re looking for the fastest route to a leadership position where you have total ownership of results.





The Technical Translator: You can sit with a developer and talk server-side rendering, then turn around and explain to a CEO exactly how that technical fix will 2x their ROI.





Your Arsenal (What You’ll Be Doing)

Lead the AI Frontier: Architect the agency’s AI-SEO workflow. You will be responsible for staying 6 months ahead of the industry in how we use LLMs for content strategy and technical automation.





Strategic Troubleshooting: Solve the "unsolvable" SEO problems—manual actions, algorithmic de-indexing, and sophisticated crawl budget issues.





Revenue-First SEO: You will link every backlink and every line of code to the client’s bottom line. If it doesn't drive revenue, we don't do it.





Tea
ntorship: As you master our systems, you will begin building and leading your own squad of "Digital Warriors," scaling your expertise across the entire agency.





The Code You Live By

3+ Years in the Trenches: You’ve seen updates come and go. You don’t flinch at a red graph; you find the leverage point to turn it green.

Prompt Engineering Mastery: You can demonstrate how you use AI to do 10 hours of work in 30 minutes without sacrificing an ounce of quality.

Extreme Ownership: You don't blame "the algorithm." You take responsibility for the outcome.

Global Vision: You understand the nuances of International SEO and how to build authority in any market, on any scale.





The Pay-Off

Leadership Track: We are hiring you to eventually run the SEO department. Prove your worth, and the keys are yours.

High-Stakes Compensation: We don't lowball. We pay for performance and elite skill.

Radical Autonomy: Work from anywhere. We don't care about your hours; we care about your impact.

The "No BS" Guarantee: We fire nightmare clients who don’t listen. We protect our warriors.



Only apply thru here:

title: Direct Response Copywriter (DTC, Meta Ads)
description:
We’re a fast-growing DTC health e-commerce brand scaling through
 ads, currently at a $20M+ annual run rate.



We are looking for a Direct Response Copywriter who understands how to turn angles, mechanisms, and customer psychology into ads that convert at scale.



This role is not about writing pretty copy. It’s about building ads that spend.



You will be working directly with proven winning formats, iterating on what works, and creating new concepts that push performance further. You’ll have full autonomy to think, test, and execute without corporate friction.



What we care about:

- AT LEAST 3+ Years of experience with DTC Meta ads for e-commerce brands

- Writing scripts with clear visual direction (what the creator is doing, what’s on screen, what b-roll is needed)

- Understanding how to iterate on winning ads without copying them

- Thinking in hooks, structures, and formats that work on
 Feed

- Speed, volume, and clarity of thinking



What you get:

- Lucrative base pay + heavy performance bonuses tied to winning ads

- Clear opportunity to grow into a larger role, such as a Creative Strategist

- Work inside a team that already knows how to scale ads, but needs more creative firepower

- Freedom to operate without micromanagement



If you’re obsessed with high-performing ads, angles, and making creatives that actually scale, you’ll fit right in.



IMPORTANT: please do not apply if you do not have extensive direct response experience with Shopify E-commerce brands. 



Apply by messaging us “I’m in” with your portfolio showing in-depth experience with creating DTC ads for e-commerce brands, along with examples of ads you have created.





Please Note: We will not reply back if you do not message us exactly what we put above!

title: Executive Assistant / Operations Assistant
description:
Read This First:

Mandatory Requirement – Read Carefully

All applicants must complete a Culture Index assessment.

Applications without a completed Culture Index will be ignored.

No exceptions.



Please use this link to take the test: 
/s/A11TNMSuK1



We are hiring a senior-level Executive Assistant to work directly with the Founder of a growing U.S.-based supportive housing and real estate operation. You will function as a right-hand operator, not a task taker.

If you need step-by-step instructions, this role will not work for you.

If you are proactive, systems-driven, and used to running ahead of executives—keep reading.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing



Executive Support:

- Own inbox management (prioritize, draft responses, follow-ups)

-Full calendar control (scheduling, rescheduling, reminders, prep)

-Track commitments, deadlines, and open loops

-Prepare summaries, notes, and documents





Operations & Team Support:

-Coordinate hiring (job posts, screening, scheduling interviews)

-Communicate with employees (updates, reminders, follow-ups)

-Organize SOPs, templates, internal docs

-Improve workflows and recommend better systems





Real Estate & Property Operations:

-Communicate with landlords and property owners

-Prepare leases, addendums, and basic agreements (templates provided)

-Track maintenance issues across multiple properties

-Schedule vendors, repairs, inspections, and follow-ups

-Maintain clean property and maintenance logs





Outreach & Prospecting:

-LinkedIn prospecting for referral sources and partners

-Draft and manage outreach and follow-up messages

-Track conversations and responses





Light Personal Admin:

-Occasional personal scheduling or logistics to reduce executive load





This Role Is NOT For

- Entry-level VAs

- Applicants juggling multiple clients

- Anyone who waits to be told what to do

- People who “just execute tasks”





You are expected to think, d
, and improve systems.



Required Experience:

-3+ years supporting a founder, executive, or business owner

-Strong written English (professional, clear, concise)

-Experience managing
 and calendars independently

-Comfortable handling confidential information

-Confident communicating with landlords, vendors, and staff





Tools You Must Already Know:

-Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets)

-Task/project tools (ClickUp, Asana, Notion, or similar)

-LinkedIn search and messaging







Strongly Preferred

-Real estate, property management, construction, healthcare, or social services experience

-Experience creating or improving systems

-Ability to train the executive on best practices







Work Details

- Remote | Full-time preferred

-Must overlap with Pacific Time

-Long-term role with growing responsibility







Pay

Competitive and based on experience.

Top performers are rewarded long-term.



How to Apply

Submit:

-Resume

-Short cover letter explaining:

-Your executive support experience

-Why you are a strong fit for this role

-Confirmation that you have taken the Culture Index test







Final Note

We are looking for someone who wants long-term stability.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant
description:

This is a non-client-facing role for now, focused purely on internal execution, support, and operational follow-through.



Daytime PH hours, with some evening overlap for U.S. meetings

            - Perform data entry and track recurring operational tasks

            - Assist with light bookkeeping (e.g., expense categorization, rent reminders)

       4. Organization & Executive Support

            - Assist with cross-platform organization 
, tools, cloud storage)

       5. Ad Hoc Support

            - Make simple edits in Canva (e.g., business cards, flyers)

            - Support ongoing operational projects and to-do list items



Qualifications

         - Communication: Excellent written English; responsive and professional

         - Initiative: Comfortable taking ownership and figuring things out independently

         - Tech-Savvy: Familiar with tools like Google Workspace, Trello, Slack/WhatsApp, Zoom

To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "Availability" in the subject line of your
.



We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Executive Virtual Assistant (Real Estate-Focused)
description:
We are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Executive Virtual Assistant to support the daily operations of a real estate business. This role focuses on CRM management, marketing execution, website updates, and administrative coordination.



This is a long-term opportunity ideal for someone who enjoys working with digital tools, following established systems, and helping a business stay organized, consistent, and efficient.



U.S. Daytime Business Hours

(Crossover hours: Philippine daytime or late afternoon/evening U.S. time)





Job duties and responsibilities:

 

1. CRM & Administrative Support

       - Manage and maintain the CRM system (BoldTrail / formerly KV Core or similar CRM)

       - Set up and manage:



                -
 campaigns and drip sequences

                - Monthly newsletters

                - Client follow-ups and communication lists



       - Assist with CRM automations and built-in AI tools

       - Upload, organize, and manage transaction-related files (internal use only)



2. Marketing & Content Support

       - Create and schedule social media posts (Instagram &
) using existing Canva 

          templates

       - Edit flyers and other marketing materials (no brand creation required)

       - Assist with blog uploads and content updates

       - Support Google review requests and online reputation management



3. Website & Tech Support

title: Brand & Content Lead (Private Luxury Concierge)
description:
The Project

Company is an invite-only, boutique concierge for aesthetic procedure journeys in Mainland China. We bridge the gap for the Asian diaspora in North America, Europe, and Australia, providing neutral coordination, vetted surgeon networks, and on-the-ground logistics. We are currently in a private, referral-only launch phase.



The Role

I am looking for three (3) talented Brand & Content Leads to join for an initial one-month part-time trial. This is a high-trust, high-end project. You will be responsible for translating our "quiet luxury" brand values into compelling, consistent content that speaks to a sophisticated diaspora audience. 



What You’ll Do



Content Creation: Design premium carousels and IG Stories that educate and build trust.

Video Editing: Produce and edit high-quality Reels (minimalist, elegant, text/voiceover-led).

Brand Management: Maintain a consistent, neutral, and empathetic brand voice across all private channels.

Strategy: Develop content that converts private referrals into "Request Invite" applications.



Who You Are



Mature & Reliable: You have a "founder mindset," excellent communication, and never miss a deadline.

Aesthetic Authority: You have a refined "quiet luxury" design sense. You understand that in this space, less is more.

Culturally Aware: You understand the sensibilities of the North American, European, and Australian markets.

Highly Preferred: You have personally undergone medical aesthetic procedures or facials and can speak the "language" of the patient journey.

Video Savvy: You have strong video editing skills (CapCut/Premiere/InShot) with an eye for pacing and premium transitions.



The Opportunity



Trial Phase: 1-month part-time retainer for 3 selected candidates. By the end of the project, we will select one lead to continue the relationship.

Growth: Potential for a long-term relationship with increased compensation and responsibility as we scale.

Direct Impact: Work directly with the founder to shape a unique, high-integrity brand from the ground up.



How to Apply

Please send a DM or
 with:



A link to your portfolio or 3 samples of your best "premium" content (Reels + Carousels).

A brief note on your personal experience with aesthetic procedures/facials.

Your favourite "quiet luxury" brand and why its marketing works.

title: Online Researcher – U.S. Public Crash Reports
description:
Hi Team,



We are hiring 3 reliable researchers to help collect publicly available information about recent car crashes across several U.S. states. The work requires careful attention to instructions, strong online research skills, and consistent daily delivery.



What You Will Do



Your main task is to find and collect the front page of police crash reports using public sources and direct contact with police departments.



Your daily workflow will include:



• Search for recent car crashes using public city, county, or state portals.

• Identify which police department handled each i
.

• Contact the correct police department and request ONLY the front page of the crash report (not the full report).

• Gather as many valid reports as possible overnight.

• Send all collected files to me before 7:00 AM (U.S. Mountain Time) each day.



You may use the provided example portals or your own research methods to locate i
.



Important Rules



Please follow these requirements exactly:



• Reports must be less than 7 days old.

• The front page must include names and addresses of the people involved.

• Do NOT submit FOIA requests unless specifically approved. FOIA requests often take 10–14 days, which is too slow for this project.

• Many police departments can release the front page immediately under specific public-record laws. We only need that first page.



Example Workflow



Visit a public i
 portal, for example:





Find a crash i
 with location and exact call time.



Contact the relevant police department.



Request the front page only using the address and call time so they can locate the correct report.



Current Areas of Focus



We are currently collecting reports from:



Texas

• Amarillo

• McAllen

• El Paso



Ohio

• Multiple areas (details will be provided)



New Mexico

• Albuquerque

• Additional cities will be added later



More regions will be assigned as the project grows.



What We Are Looking For



• Strong English communication skills

• Ability to follow instructions carefully

• Organized file handling and daily reporting

• Comfortable contacting U.S. police departments professionally



Consistency and accuracy are more important than speed alone.



Thank you, and I look forward to working with you!

description:
Hello,



We're Sautille, a fast-growing UK toddler shoe brand. We're looking for a full-time Video Editor to create conversion-focused video ads for Meta 
/Instagram).



The job:

• Edit video ads that convert — hooks, pacing, subtitles, zooms, b-roll sequencing

• E-commerce video editing experience (Meta ads, not just TikTok or vlogs)

• Volume + quality mindset — fast and clean, not slow and over-perfectionist

What you get:

title: Ecommerce & AI Video Editor Virtual Assistant
description:
About Zulu Eden

Zulu Eden is a high-growth brand focusing on "Identity" and "Experience" products. We focus on two distinct product categories:



Cosmetic Contact Lenses: Our lenses  are about identity. We sell who you become when you wear them—whether that’s a "Soft Girl," "Baddie," or "Natural Beauty". Check us out at zulueden.co.za/contact-lens



Mechanical Keyboards: We sell a "better desk experience." Our keyboards focus on aesthetics (how it looks), ASMR (how it sounds), and the typing experience (how it feels). View the collection at zulueden.co.za/collections/keyboards.



The Role: Assembling Stories, Not Just Editing

We are looking for a Production VA to master our Design System. Your job is to take raw UGC B-roll and "assemble" it into high-converting video ads for Meta and Google PMAX.



Your Workflow:



Take raw customer/UGC B-roll footage.



Select one Identity Angle (e.g., Soft Girl vs. Baddie) or Experience Angle (e.g., ASMR vs. Aesthetic).



Match it with a specific Emotional Hook and On-Screen Text Layer.



Apply our Shot Rules (Vertical, centered, no filters, clear lighting).



Include a "Soft CTA" or specific offer.

title: Appointment Setter (Outbound Dialer)
description:
**Department:** Sales



**Reports To:** Opperational Manager 



**Schedule:** 4 hours per day



**Core Focus:** Outbound dialing ? booking appointments



### **Role Objective**

Your sole responsibility is to **consistently dial outbound leads and book qualified appointments**.

You are not closing.

You are not confirming appointments.

You are not following up beyond proper system updates.



Your job is **dial ? talk ? book ? update systems**.

## **Daily Activity Expectations**

- **Dial Time:** 4 hours per day

- **Minimum Dials:** 100 per day

- **Target Dials:** 150–200 per day

- **Working Days:** Every scheduled workday (no batching)



## **Lead Source**

- Webinar attendees who did **not** book a call

- Lists are provided to you

- Leads are refreshed regularly

- You do not source or modify leads unless instructed



## **Primary Responsibilities**

### **1. Outbound Dialing**

- Dial continuously during work hours

- Follow the approved script

- Prioritize volume and consistency

- Move on quickly after no answers



### **2. Appointment Booking**

- **Daily booking goal:** Minimum **3 appointments per day**

- Book directly into the calendar

- Verbally confirm date/time before ending the call

- Do not confirm appointments after booking



**Performance Bonus**

- $3 bonus for each appointment that:

    - Is personally booked by the Appointment Setter

    - Shows up and attends the scheduled call

    - Is properly logged in GoHighLevel and Notion



### **3. System Updates (Required)**

**GohighLevel**

**Notion**



## **Performance KPIs**

You are meeting expectations if you consistently hit:

- 100–200 dials per day

- 3+ booked appointments per day

- Accurate, same-day system updates



Repeated misses trigger coaching or role review.



## **End-of-Day Requirement**

An EOD report must be submitted **every working day** before logging off.

## **Success Standard**

This role is won by:

- Consistency

- High call volume

- Clean systems



If you think you are the one we're looking for, kindly send us your updated CV along with a 1-2min audio recording of your work experiences. Thank you!

title: Video Editor & Image Designer
description:
ABOUT US 

We are a fast-growing DTC skincare eCommerce brand. We are looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a freelancer, who wants to build a stable career with us.



We believe in empowering our team. You will get access (and training!) on premium AI tools like Higgsfield, Gemini, and ChatGPT to make your workflow faster and more creative.



WHO YOU ARE 

We are looking for a "preditor" (Producer/Editor)—someone who understands storytelling, pacing, and marketing, not just button-pushing.



- You possess a "student mindset": You take feedback well, you don't take critiques personally, and you improve quickly. We are looking for someone who wants to learn and grow, not someone who thinks they already know everything.

- You are efficient: You can edit a high-quality 60-second video in 2-3 hours and create a social graphic in 1-2 hours without sacrificing quality.

- You are detail-oriented: You have 0% tolerance for typos in captions and overlays.

- You are tech-savvy: You are excited to use AI to generate ideas and speed up your work.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

- Short-Form Video: Edit engaging Reels, Shorts, and TikToks (15–90 seconds) focused on UGC, products, and trends.

- Long-Form Video: Edit YouTube videos, and VSLs (5+ minutes) with clean pacing and storytelling.

- Engagement: Add animated captions, text callouts, B-roll, and visual hooks to keep retention high.

- Graphic Design: Create static ad creatives, quote cards, thumbnails, and simple motion ads.

- Photo Editing: Retouch, resize, and clean up product/lifestyle images.

- Copywriting: Write and polish short English hooks/headlines for your videos and ads.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS (Must Have)

- Computer Specs: You must have a PC capable of editing 4K footage and running Adobe Premiere Pro/After Effects without lag or crashing. (Recommended: 16GB+ RAM, SSD Storage).

- Internet Connection: You must have a reliable, high-speed internet connection (Fiber preferred). You will be required to download and upload large batches of raw 4K video files from Google Drive daily.

- Software: Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro (preferred), CapCut, or Final Cut + Canva/Photoshop/Figma or equivalent.



WHY JOIN US? 

- Day Shift Schedule: Enjoy your evenings and weekends! Work normal PH business hours. 

- AI Training: We pay for the tools and teach you how to use them. 

- Stability: We are looking for a partner for the long haul. 

- Portfolio: Build a portfolio with a professional beauty brand.



Schedule & Pay:

- Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM Philippine time

- $600/month



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully) 

To ensure you are paying attention to detail, applications that do not follow these steps will be ignored.



Please reply to this job post with the subject line: "Creative Editor - [Your Name]" and include the following:

- Your video introduction.

- Your Portfolio: A link to your best work. Please highlight Short-Form Videos (TikTok/Reels).

- Your updated resume.

title: Brand & Content Lead (Private Luxury Concierge)
description:
The Project

Company is an invite-only, boutique concierge for aesthetic procedure journeys in Mainland China. We bridge the gap for the Asian diaspora in North America, Europe, and Australia, providing neutral coordination, vetted surgeon networks, and on-the-ground logistics. We are currently in a private, referral-only launch phase.



The Role

I am looking for three (3) talented Brand & Content Leads to join for an initial one-month part-time trial. This is a high-trust, high-end project. You will be responsible for translating our "quiet luxury" brand values into compelling, consistent content that speaks to a sophisticated diaspora audience.



What You’ll Do



Content Creation: Design premium carousels and IG Stories that educate and build trust.

Video Editing: Produce and edit high-quality Reels (minimalist, elegant, text/voiceover-led).

Brand Management: Maintain a consistent, neutral, and empathetic brand voice across all private channels.

Strategy: Develop content that converts private referrals into "Request Invite" applications.



Who You Are



Mature & Reliable: You have a "founder mindset," excellent communication, and never miss a deadline.

Aesthetic Authority: You have a refined "quiet luxury" design sense. You understand that in this space, less is more.

Culturally Aware: You understand the sensibilities of the North American, European, and Australian markets.

Highly Preferred: You have personally undergone medical aesthetic procedures or facials and can speak the "language" of the patient journey.

Video Savvy: You have strong video editing skills (CapCut/Premiere/InShot) with an eye for pacing and premium transitions.



The Opportunity



Trial Phase: 1-month part-time retainer for 3 selected candidates. By the end of the project, we will select one lead to continue the relationship.

Growth: Potential for a long-term relationship with increased compensation and responsibility as we scale.

Direct Impact: Work directly with the founder to shape a unique, high-integrity brand from the ground up.



How to Apply

Please send a DM or
 with:



A link to your portfolio or 3 samples of your best "premium" content (Reels + Carousels).

A brief note on your personal experience with aesthetic procedures/facials.

Your favourite "quiet luxury" brand and why its marketing works.

title: EXPERIENCED Social Media DM Setter [Organic Lead Outreach Specialist] VA
description:
Please Read Before You Apply!



We are seeking a highly motivated and reliable
 & Instagram DM Setter [Organic Lead Outreach Specialist] to join our fast-growing team



This role focuses on organic outreach to identify our ideal client avatar by engaging in conversations with both new and warm leads, building rapport, and booking qualified sales calls.



Important Note: This position REQUIRES relevant experience and skills. If you do not have prior experience, please DO NOT apply. We appreciate your understanding and encourage qualified candidates to submit their applications.

________________ 



What You’ll Do:



As a DM Setter, you will empower others and transform lives through meaningful connections.



1. Familiarize yourself with our products and services. 



2. Identify potential clients and generate new qualified leads on Instagram and
. 



3. Proactively initiate and manage DM conversations with prospects using proven scripts. 



4. Foster meaningful connections and engagements to lead to webinar links and booked calls. 



5. Schedule appointments between qualified prospects and the sales team. 



6. Follow up intelligently during your assigned daily shift. 



7. Meet daily and weekly KPIs for conversations, follow-ups, and bookings. 



8. Send an end-of-day report with key stats and 5–10 conversation screenshots for coaching. 

________________ 



What We’re Looking For:



1. Experience: Must be a seasoned VA with prior experience in DM setting and organic outreach (we do not provide client data). 



2. Track Record: Proven success in DM setting within B2C, coaches, entrepreneurs, or high-ticket coaching industries. 



3. Social Media Marketing: Solid experience in social media marketing. 



4. Communication: Strong English skills with an understanding of emotional tone and conversation flow. 



5. Emotional Intelligence: High emotional intelligence, enthusiasm, and optimism. 



6. Initiative: Organized with attention to detail, able to work well in a fast-paced remote environment. 



7. Coachable: Open to feedback and eager to improve. 



8. Preference: Female applicants are preferred. 

________________ 



This Role Is NOT For You If:



1. You have NO experience as a VA or DM Setter. 



2. You rely solely on provided client databases (we do not offer any). 



3. You have experience only in cold calling; we focus on DM skills. 



4. You are uncomfortable with time tracking with screenshots. 



5. You're not willing to go the extra mile to connect with prospects. 



6. A pessimistic attitude or lack of enthusiasm will not align with our team values. 

________________ 



Compensation:



>> Fully remote work (PH-based) 

>> Part-time role: approximately 20 hours per week (with potential to scale) 

>> Working with clients from Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the US, and the UK 

>> Salary based on experience: Realistic earnings of AUD $480/month - AUD $800/month 

>> Performance-based bonuses 

________________ 



If you’re ready to make an impact and help businesses grow, apply today by clicking the link below to fill out your application form and join a team shaping the future of global organic lead generation.







Only applications submitted through the link will be considered; submissions via
 will be ignored. Please check your inbox frequently, as we communicate via
 with qualified applicants. 



Thank you, and we look forward to reviewing your application.



Best regards,

Set and Scale Co.

title: Virtual Assistant – Podcast + Short-Form Content Editor (Premiere Pro)
description:
We’re expanding our team and hiring a full-time Virtual Assistant to support our podcast workflow and content repurposing. This role is primarily focused on video/audio editing, short-form content creation, and graphics, with additional writing and data-encoding/admin support as needed.



If you’re detail-oriented, creative, reliable, and eager to learn, we want to hear from you.



What You’ll Be Doing



You’ll assist with podcast production and repurpose long-form episodes into content for multiple platforms. Daily tasks may include:

- Cleaning up, organizing, and formatting podcast transcripts

- Editing and polishing audio for podcast episodes and clips

- Editing video and creating short-form clips/reels (with captions, pacing, and clean cuts)

- Creating quote graphics and simple social media visuals

- Optimizing show notes using basic SEO principles (headings, keywords, formatting, readability)

- Writing support as needed (light editing, rewriting, summaries, show notes, captions)

- Data encoding/admin support (updating spreadsheets, uploading assets, organizing files, publishing support)



Required Skills & Experience

You must already have strong working knowledge of:

- Video editing (Primary tool): Adobe Premiere Pro

- Secondary editing tool: Descript (for transcripts, captions, clip workflows, etc.)

- Short-form editing tools: CapCut

- Graphics creation: Canva

- Written English: clear writing and strong listening comprehension

- Basic tech/VA skills: Google Docs/Drive, spreadsheets, WordPress (or willingness to learn), general computer proficiency



Additional Points If You:

- Have experience with audio cleanup (nice to have: Adobe Audition or similar)

- Have experience with Photoshop (nice to have, not required)

- Have experience with social media publishing/scheduling tools

- Are proactive in solving problems and asking questions when stuck

- Can work well independently, communicate clearly, and meet deadlines consistently



Work Schedule

- Choose a consistent 8-hour work window. Our preferred hours are 12 PM – 8 PM US Eastern Time, but we’re flexible.

- You’ll clock in and out via Slack every workday.



Pay & Benefits

- $2.12/hour. Guaranteed 40 hours/week = $85 USD/week (~$390/month)

- Paid weekly via PayPal in PHP (we cover conversion fees)

- Paid Philippine holidays

- 13th-month pay

- 12 sick days and 12 vacation days per year

- Small summer bonuses every 6 months

- Raises every 12 months



How to Apply

If you’re interested and meet the qualifications above, reply with your
 address. We’ll send you an invite to interview via our Slack channel.

title: YouTube Producer and Channel Manager
description:
We are looking for an authority-driven business media YouTube Producer and Channel Manager.



ABOUT THE CHANNEL



We are building a YouTube-led media brand focused on how businesses are actually bought and sold — exits, acquisitions, and investor psychology.



The audience is experienced entrepreneurs and founders who are profitable, generating $1M+ in annual revenue, and considering a partial or full exit in the next 12–36 months.



This is not an influencer channel. The goal is to build trust, authority, and proprietary deal flow.



THE ROLE: 



The YouTube Producer and Channel Manager will own the strategy, production oversight, and optimization of a YouTube-first content ecosystem designed to educate founders, build credibility, and generate inbound conversations with potential sellers.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



- Develop and own the channel’s content strategy across talking-head episodes, founder exit interviews, and investor interviews.

- Build and maintain a quarterly content roadmap and publishing calendar.

- Collaborate with the host to refine episode concepts, hooks, and contrarian angles.

- Coordinate production workflows with scriptwriters, editors, and designers.

- Oversee titles, thumbnails, descriptions, and publishing across platforms.

- Analyze performance metrics with a focus on retention, audience quality, and inbound conversations.

- Optimize CTAs to drive LinkedIn connections and qualified founder DMs.

- Continuously refine the content strategy based on audience feedback and analytics.



SUCCESS METRICS



- Consistent weekly long-form publishing cadence.

- Improving audience retention and watch time.

- Growth in qualified founder conversations and inbound deal opportunities.

- Increasing trust signals from experienced founders and operators.

- Sustained growth of returning viewers and subscribers.



IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE



• 5+ years of experience with YouTube or long-form business media.

• Proven experience scaling authority-driven or expertise-led channels.

• Strong strategic thinking combined with hands-on execution ability.

• Understanding of business, startups, investing, or M&A-adjacent content.

• Comfortable challenging ideas and shaping strong points of view.



WORKING MODEL and COMPENSATION



• Part-time contract role to start, with potential to grow.

• Remote collaboration with direct access to the host.

• Competitive monthly retainer based on experience.



Does the description above sound like you? 

If YES, APPLY NOW!

title: Bookkeeper Assistant
description:
SENIOR BOOKKEEPING ASSISTANT (U.S. ACCOUNTING | REMOTE)



Immanuel & AnG’s Financial Services

DBA Grow Thrive Prosper Collective



We are seeking an experienced Bookkeeping Assistant who brings accuracy, ownership, and clear communication to every task. This role supports U.S.-based clients and internal operations and requires strong judgment—not just data entry.



If you understand why entries are made (not just how), this role is for you.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



  Maintain and review books in QuickBooks Online and Xero



  Reconcile bank and credit card accounts with precision

  

  Identify, flag, track, maintain and process 1099 vendors/contractors



  Support U.S. payroll workflows through providers such as Gusto, ADP, and Paychex



  Apply double-entry accounting principles confidently



  Identify, prepare, and post manual journal entries when required



  Flag inconsistencies, errors, or missing documentation proactively



  Communicate clearly with leadership and client regarding financial issues or risks



  Support month-end close, year-end close and operational bookkeeping processes



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



  Proven experience with QuickBooks Online and/or Xero



  Practical understanding of U.S. payroll processing (third-party providers)



  Strong grasp of double-entry accounting



  Experience creating manual journal entries with proper documentation



  High attention to detail and accuracy



  Professional written and verbal communication skills



IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE



  Operationally strong and systems-oriented



  Detail-focused but able to see the bigger picture



  Communicates clearly and respectfully



  Takes initiative and ownership of work



  Comfortable working with U.S. accounting standards and tax laws



ROLE DETAILS



  Remote position



  Long-term opportunity



  Part-time to start, with potential to expand



  Work with a structured, values-driven financial services firm



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS



  To be considered, please include:



  Your bookkeeping experience with U.S. clients



  Accounting software you’ve used (and at what level)



  Payroll platforms you’ve worked with

title: Short form video editor
description:
**Elite Short-Form Video Editor for Viral TikTok & Instagram Content**



We're hunting for a video editor who lives and breathes TikTok and Instagram culture—someone who can turn raw footage into scroll-stopping, viral-worthy content.



**What You'll Be Editing:**

- High-volume TikTok and Instagram Reels

- Fast-paced, trend-driven content that hooks viewers in the first second

- Content for business/personal brand accounts targeting American audiences



**Non-Negotiable Requirements:**

- **Software:** CapCut and/or Adobe Premiere Pro (CapCut preferred for efficiency)

- **Speed:** Lightning-fast turnaround (same-day to 24-hour delivery on most edits)

- **Language:** Fluent English with understanding of slang, humor, and cultural nuances

- **Internet:** High-speed, stable connection for rapid file sharing

- **Availability:** Flexible schedule with some overlap for US time zones

- **Platform Knowledge:** Active personal TikTok/Instagram user who understands the 2026 algorithm



**What Makes You the Perfect Fit:**

- You spend hours daily on TikTok and Instagram and can name current trending sounds, formats, and 
s

- You understand hook formulas: pattern interrupts, scroll-stoppers, and the "3-second rule"

- You know when to use fast cuts, transitions, text animations, captions, zooms, and effects

- You can match trending audio perfectly to visual beats

- You understand pacing that keeps viewers watching until the end (crucial for algorithm performance)

- You know the difference between TikTok editing style vs. Instagram Reels vs. YouTube Shorts



**Technical Skills You Must Have:**

- Understanding of viral growth strategies and what makes content shareable

- Expert-level text animations and dynamic captions (Gen-Z style fonts and timing)

- Sound design and audio layering (trending sounds, SFX, voiceover mixing)

- Color grading for phone screens 

- Aspect ratio optimization (9:16 vertical formatting)

- On-brand transitions and effects that enhance, not distract

- Experience repurposing long-form content into multiple short clips

- Knowledge of caption writing that drives engagement



**To Apply, Please Submit:**

1. Portfolio with 5-10 short-form videos you've edited (TikTok/Reels format)

2. Links to any accounts where your edited content has performed well (views, engagement)

3. Your typical turnaround time for a 15-30 second video

4. 3 examples of current TikTok trends you'd use for business content

5. Your rate structure (per video, weekly package, or monthly retainer)





**Red Flags (Please Don't Apply If):**

- You add outdated transitions, effects, or "2019 YouTube" style editing

- You don't personally use TikTok or Instagram daily

- You need more than 24 hours for simple edits

- You don't understand American humor, sarcasm, or cultural references



**What We Offer:**

- High volume of consistent work (not sporadic projects)

- Creative freedom within brand guidelines

- Fast payment cycles

- Performance bonuses when your edits go viral

- Potential for long-term partnership and rate increases based on performance

- Opportunity to work on content that actually gets views and grows accounts

- potential high profile clients that will look great on your portfolio
