title: Senior Medical Coder
description:
Senior Medical Coder

Primary Care / General Medicine

Remote — Philippines | US Business Hours | Full-Time





Role Summary

We are looking for an experienced medical coder to handle the full range of encounter types for a US-based primary care practice. This includes routine E/M visits, Medicare-specific coding (AWV, CCM, preventive), and encounters requiring modifier usage and clinical judgment. You will be responsible for maintaining coding accuracy and compliance across Medicare, Medi-Cal, and commercial PPO payers. Depending on team structure, you may also provide quality assurance review for other coding staff.

Responsibilities

• Code all encounter types for a primary care / general medicine practice, including E/M visits (99201–99215), preventive medicine, chronic care management, and Annual Wellness Visits

• Apply correct ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes and CPT codes based on provider documentation

• Handle Medicare, Medi-Cal, and commercial PPO coding distinctions, including AWV vs. preventive vs. E/M billing

• Apply modifiers accurately, particularly Modifier 25 and Modifier 59

• Complete superbills in the EHR and ensure clean data transfer to billing software for claim submission

• Identify and flag documentation gaps that prevent compliant coding, and communicate these to the US-based team

• Review encounters coded by other tea
mbers when applicable, and flag recurring error patterns

• Assist with backlog clearance of historical encounters as needed

• Communicate directly with the US-based team lead on coding questions, volume updates, and escalations

Required Qualifications

• Minimum 3 years of medical coding experience for US healthcare providers

• Demonstrated experience with Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial PPO coding in a primary care or internal medicine setting

• Strong working knowledge of E/M leveling (2021 MDM-based guidelines), ICD-10-CM, and CPT

• Experience with modifier usage and understanding of common audit risk areas

• Familiarity with US payer denial patterns and how coding errors lead to claim rejections

• Ability to work independently and exercise judgment on complex or ambiguous encounters

• Fluent in English (written and verbal)

Preferred Qualifications

• CPC, CCS, or equivalent coding certification

• Experience working for a US-facing BPO, billing company, or RCM firm

• Experience mentoring or QA-reviewing other coders

• Familiarity with California Medi-Cal managed care and IPA capitation structures

• Experience with Practice Fusion, Practice Suite, or similar US EHR/billing platforms

title: Long-Term Finance Video Editor YouTube
description:
Urgently Needed!! Long-Term Finance Video YouTube Editor



We have this editing opportunity for you, looking to start immediately. You will be editing finance talking head videos 10-15 minutes long. Let us know asap if you are interested!



Format Requirements:

The first 12-15 seconds of the video will be a dramatic and highly edited intro highlighting what the highlighted speaker is about to say, “coming up” in the video. 



Afterwards, you will add b-roll and related footage following our guidelines that is extremely relevant to what the speaker is saying throughout the video, like the reference.



Reference Videos: 
 



The pay for this project is $2.00-$2.50 per minute of the final video depending on the complexity. If you do the job well, we will have more videos for you to work on per day.

Please attach previous relevant projects/portfolio you have done for reference, thanks!





Editing guidelines:

We are looking for simple but effective editing. You will add editing to help the viewer better understand what is being said in the video, avoiding spamming random editing or making it more confusing. You will cut out audio spaces above 0.5 seconds or stutters the speaker makes.



In the first two mins, we will show b-roll and change every 8 seconds. We will switch between the tiny screen and the big screen. The speaker in the big screen format in the first 15 seconds and leave it there for 1-2 sentences. 

Tiny screen: There is b-roll on the right hand side but the speaker is also featured on the left hand side.

Big screen: This means that we just show the speaker talking without b-roll. It is good to do this when you don’t have any good ideas for which b-roll to put.



Notes on B-roll:

The b-roll should not be annoying to the viewer and only show to help illustrate the point. Random b-rolls of a stock market or a random person that is not related does not help the viewer understand.



For the b-roll, make sure it’s not something randomly generic. You should put some thought into what is being shown, not just randomly put the first image that pops up when search up. It is easy to tell.

title: Short-term contract – Technical MVP Builder (Code or No-Code)
description:
(Title doesn’t matter. What I care about is delivering a working MVP, fast.)



I’m looking for someone to help me build a simple but functional MVP for an internal recruitment tool.



This is a short-term, paid contract, not a full-time role. The objective is very pragmatic: deliver something that works reliably. UI polish, animations, and perfect design are not a priority at this stage. I will provide clear guidance, feedback, and quick iterations throughout the project.



The tool helps recruiters compare multiple CVs to a job description and quickly identify the most relevant candidates. The workflow is straightforward: upload CVs, create a job description, run a matching process, and display a ranked list of candidates with clear explanations (strengths, gaps, risks).



This is not an ATS, not a sourcing platform, and not a commercial product. It is an internal decision-support tool designed to save time and improve prioritization.



For this initial phase, the scope is intentionally limited to CVs only. No LinkedIn integration, no scraping, no authentication, and no billing. CV files are uploaded, parsed via an external API, stored in a database, compared to a job description, and displayed in a simple admin-style interface.



The technical stack is already defined and kept intentionally simple. You can use code, low-code, or a mix of both, as long as the result is a working MVP.



Estimated scope: 15–25 hours. Initial paid test.

Possible extension if the collaboration goes well.



To apply, briefly describe a project where you built a functional MVP involving API integrations and data handling, and share your availability over the next two to three weeks.



Thank you,

Oliver

title: Lead Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Operations
description:
Hyman Properties is an active real estate investment company focused on wholesaling residential properties and vacant land across multiple U.S. states.



We are hiring a Lead Virtual Assistant to run day-to-day operations, manage data and VAs, and help refine systems. This role is for someone who understands real estate operations end-to-end — not just tasks.



If you need step-by-step instructions for everything, this role is not a fit.



?



What You’ll Own

 • Seller & buyer list pulling and organization

 • Google Sheets systems (buyers, sellers, KPIs, VA logs)

 • Oversight of cold callers and data VAs

 • Data quality control (clean, usable lists)

 • Daily performance tracking and reporting

 • Flagging issues before they become problems

 • Improving workflows as volume increases



?



Minimum Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



? 2+ years as a Real Estate VA

? Hands-on experience with wholesaling and/or vacant land

? Personally pulled lists using PropStream, BatchLeads, PropWire, or similar

? Comfortable managing multiple VAs

? Strong Google Sheets skills

? Able to think independently and explain why you do things



???? If your experience is limited to admin work or social media, do not apply.



?



How to Apply



 

Subject line:

Lead Real Estate VA – Application – [Your Name]



Applications without thoughtful, specific answers will not be reviewed.



?



Application Questions 



Answer clearly and specifically. Short or generic answers will be rejected.

 1. How many years have you worked as a real estate VA, and what deal types were involved (wholesale, land, flips, rentals, etc.)?

 2. List every real estate platform you have personally used and explain what you used each one for.

 3. You are asked to pull a vacant land seller list in one county for an investor who wants motivated sellers.

 • Which platform do you choose and why?

 • List at least 6 filters you would apply and explain the purpose of each.

 4. How do you verify that a list is high quality before it is skip-traced or sent to cold callers?

 5. Describe your exact process for organizing buyers across multiple states so they can be matched to deals quickly.

 6. You have 3 cold callers working 3 hours per day.

 • What KPIs do you track daily and weekly?

 • What numbers would signal a problem?

 7. Describe a real system, SOP, or workflow you personally built or improved for a real estate investor.

 8. If list performance drops suddenly, what are the first 3 things you check?

 9. What time zone are you in, and how many hours per day can you commit consistently?

 10. Why should we trust you to operate at a lead level instead of a task-based VA role?

        11. What are some of the states you have done cold calling in?

title: Amazon Graphic Designer- Night Shift
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a talented Graphic Designer to join our client’s creative team. This role is ideal for someone who can balance clean, conversion-friendly design with bold, witty, and brand-aligned visuals. You'll work across digital and print assets, including product packaging, website graphics, social media content, and marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate is a strong visual storyteller with a good sense of humor, a keen eye for detail, and a desire to work in a fast-paced, product-focused environment.



 



Responsibilities



Design marketing assets for digital campaigns, including website banners,
 graphics, and paid social ads

Create and update packaging designs for physical products

Collaborate with the creative, marketing, and product teams to develop cohesive visual concepts

Produce graphics and templates for social media, product launches, and promotions

Maintain and evolve the visual identity in line with brand guidelines

Assist in occasional photo editing, mockup creation, and layout design for print or web

Manage multiple design projects with shifting priorities and deadlines



Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have:



2+ years of experience in graphic design (consumer product or DTC brand experience preferred)

Strong portfolio showcasing design work across digital and print

Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (especially Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)

Excellent sense of layout, typography, color, and visual hierarchy

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, iterative, and collaborative environment

Strong communication skills and attention to detail

Nice-to-Have:



Experience with lifestyle brands or e-commerce design

Familiarity with Figma, Canva, or other collaborative design tools

Basic understanding of web design or UX principles

Photography or video editing experience

A witty or playful design sensibility that matches a fun, irreverent brand tone

Key Characteristics:



Playful Creativity: You’re not afraid to experiment and bring a fun, unexpected twist to your designs—while keeping them on-brand and polished.

Detail-Oriented: You sweat the small stuff—kerning, alignment, spacing—because you know it all adds up to great design.

Collaborative Spirit: You work well with others, take feedback in stride, and are always looking to improve the final result through teamwork.

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
?? BEFORE YOU APPLY ??



NO AGENCIES – Individual applicants only

DO NOT contact me outside this platform – You will be ignored

AI-written submissions will be deleted immediately – We want genuine, human-written responses



???? START YOUR APPLICATION WITH:

OPS READY - [Years supporting Australian teams] - [Your Xero experience level: Basic/Intermediate/Advanced]

...followed by a silly office joke. Make us smile.

If you miss these simple instructions we will not consider you.



The Role:

Our work is hands-on and fast-paced. We need a sharp, proactive Operations Coordinator who can keep the back-end of our team organised as well as owning a bit of financial admin. This isn't a traditional bookkeeping gig (we do have accountants) – you'll be embedded in daily operations, not buried in spreadsheets or xero alone.



Day-to-Day Responsibilities:



Operations & Team Support (50%):

-- Listen in on tea
etings, capture action items and follow-ups

-- Manage reminders and ensure nothing slips through the cracks (can use Trello etc).

-- Complete recurring tasks for the team (briefs, some scheduling, some project admin)

-- Maintain comms via WhatsApp, chat and
 – responsiveness is critical

-- Attend team weekly 30-minute director meetings and present updates



Financial Admin (50%):

-- Process fortnightly payroll for 8 employees (STP, payslips, super via Xero)

-- Weekly reconciliations in Xero (there really aren't that many)

-- Process bills, receipts and approved invoices in Xero (again, there aren't that many).

-- Monthly IAS and quarterly BAS submissions (alternatively this could go to the accountant)

-- Debtor follow-ups at 7, 14, 30-day intervals 
 only, we can do calls).

-- Some basic weekly projections and reporting on spreadsheets.



Required (Non-Negotiable):

 -- Strong Google Suite, Docs & Sheets skills

 -- Standard bookkeeping knowledge 

 -- Fluent written and spoken English



Nice to Have:

Work Arrangement:

 -- We are fully remote business, with HQ in Perth, WA.

 -- Our operating hours are 8am-5pm, Mon-Fri.

 -- Must be online and available during these hours unless pre-arranged



Perks:

 -- Growth opportunity as the business & group expands



Submission Requirements:

 -- Your test line + silly joke (see above)

 -- Examples of team support/ops work and some bookkeeping

 -- How you'd handle chasing a 60-day overdue invoice

 -- How you'd set up and track tasks for a website project.



Rates negotiable based on attention to detail, communication, and your speed vs quality balance.

ntum.

s and communications for review prior to sending.

- Keep CRM records and files updated and accurate, maintaining strong pipeline hygiene.

- Manage client onboarding and workflow updates in SuiteDash, ensuring all documents, tasks, and records are correctly set up.

- Produce basic CRM reports when required.

- Build and maintain a bank of SOPs (standard operating procedures), ensuring documentation is current and easy to follow.



QUALIFICATIONS:

- Proven track record in lead generation and pipeline support, with strong capability in maintaining clean, accurate, and current lead data in a CRM.

- Experience using SuiteDash or equivalent tools to support client onboarding, documentation, and ongoing workflow coordination.

- Strong written and verbal communication; professional, friendly, and trustworthy.

- Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities independently.

- Proficiency with Canva/AI tools and Google/Microsoft suites; comfortable learning new systems quickly.

- Experience with event coordination and CRM tools is highly regarded.



At Boundless Collective, we take pride in fostering a culture of confidence, reliability, and a relentless commitment to excellence. If you are ready to support a dynamic executive team and grow in a supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Ready to make an impact and elevate your career? Apply via link below and let's create something extraordinary together!

title: High-Quality Editors & Social Media Managers
description:
We are building a high-output media operation and are looking for elite editors and social media managers who understand how to turn long-form content into viral short-form clips across Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



This is not a casual editing role.

This is for people who understand attention, pacing, trends, and storytelling.

ROLE OVERVIEW



You will be responsible for:



- Clipping podcasts, livestreams, interviews, motivational speeches, and raw content

- Turning them into digestible, scroll-stopping short-form videos

- Creating and managing multiple social media accounts to distribute content

- Posting consistently and optimizing for views, retention, saves, and shares



Your job is to make content viral.



RESPONSIBILITIES (EDITORIAL)

Content Clipping & Editing

* Identify viral 
nts in long-form content

* Clip and repurpose into:

    * TikToks

    * Instagram Reels

    * YouTube Shorts

* Apply strong hooks in the first 1–3 seconds

* Add:

    * Captions / subtitles

    * Punch-in zooms

    * Pattern interrupts

    * Sound effects (when appropriate)

* Match edits to the narrative and emotion of the clip

* Use trending formats and sounds where relevant

We are looking for editors who understand:

* Retention curves

* Watch time psychology

* Viral pacing

* Platform-specific styles



RESPONSIBILITIES (SOCIAL MEDIA)

Account Creation & Management

* Create and manage social media accounts for content distribution

* Understand platform differences (IG vs TikTok vs Shorts)

* Post consistently and strategically

* Follow platform trends and adapt quickly

* Track what works and double down on winning formats

This role requires initiative — not just posting, but thinking.



WHO THIS IS FOR

You are a good fit if:

* You’ve edited podcast clips, livestreams, or motivational content before

* You understand why some clips go viral and others don’t

* You can spot engaging 
nts quickly

* You care about quality, not just volume

* You keep up with TikTok / Reels / Shorts trends

* You want to be part of a serious media operation, not a one-off gig



EXPERIENCE LEVELS ACCEPTED

* Intermediate editors with proven experience

* Advanced editors & social media managers

* Beginners only if you can prove strong understanding of viral editing

Experience with CapCut, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut, or similar is preferred.



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)

To apply, TEXT ONLY — do not
.

WhatsApp:?+1 (443)
Send a message with:

1. Job Role (Editor / Social Media Manager / Both)

2. Your experience level

3. Why you’re perfect for this role

4. (Optional but recommended) Examples of work or past experience

Messages that do not include job role + experience may be ignored.

title: Project  Manager
description:
Job Title

Project Manager – Short-Term Rental Operations (Guesty / Airbnb / VRBO)



Location

Remote (San Diego–based company)



About Us

We are a fast-growing, high-performing short-term rental company managing 30+ premium properties across Southern California. Our operation is systems-driven, fast-paced, and guest-focused. We are seeking a highly capable Project Manager who can take ownership, communicate confidently, and help run day-to-day operations at a high level.



This role is ideal for someone who is extremely organized, proactive, tech-savvy, and comfortable speaking with guests, vendors, and internal teams. Strong spoken English and phone presence are absolutely critical.



Key Responsibilities

• Serve as a primary point of contact for guest communication across Airbnb, VRBO, and direct bookings

• Confidently handle phone calls with guests, vendors, and tea
mbers using clear, professional English

• Manage daily operations inside Guesty, including reservations, messaging, special offers, calendar accuracy, and issue resolution

• Coordinate with cleaning, maintenance, and operations teams to ensure smooth turnovers and rapid issue resolution

• Proactively identify problems and implement solutions without needing constant direction

• Maintain and update records using Google Sheets, Excel, and internal tracking systems

• Support pricing coordination, availability accuracy, and operational workflows

• Use AI tools (including ChatGPT) to assist with research, communication drafting, and problem-solving

• Help improve systems, workflows, and internal processes as the business scales



Required Skills & Experience

• Extensive experience using Guesty & Monday Task Manager

• Strong background in short-term rental operations (Airbnb, VRBO, direct bookings)

• Excellent spoken and written English — must sound confident, professional, and natural on the phone

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable

• Strong problem-solving ability and comfort handling multiple tasks independently

• Experience using Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Drive) and Excel

• Comfortable learning new tools and systems quickly



Nice to Have

• Experience with Slack 

• Experience supporting U.S.-based short-term rental portfolios

• Prior project management or operations leadership experience



What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone proactive, reliable, and sharp — someone who takes ownership, communicates clearly, and consistently delivers high-quality work. You should enjoy solving problems, improving systems, and working in a fast-paced environment.



Compensation

Competitive pay based on experience, with opportunities for long-term growth, increased responsibility, and performance-based raises.



How to Apply

Please include:

• A short introduction

• Your experience with Guesty, Airbnb, and VRBO

• Your availability and time zone

• Examples of how you’ve handled complex guest or operational issues

• Confirmation that you are comfortable speaking with guests and vendors by phone

title: Athena-Trained VA for Business (Australian Hours)
description:
We are an Australian-based business looking to bring on a highly reliable, Athena-trained Virtual Assistant to support our day to day operations.



This role is suited to someone who has completed Athena training and has strong experience working long term with clients from Australia, the US, or other Western countries. Athena training is a key requirement for this role, and applications without Athena experience will not be considered.



The core responsibilities of this position include scheduling and calendar management, staff communication and coordination, travel planning and booking, and general virtual assistant support. There will also be some light social media related tasks from time to time. All role-specific training will be provided, so you do not need prior experience with our internal systems.



We are looking for someone who is organised, proactive, and comfortable managing multiple moving parts. Clear communication, attention to detail, and the ability to follow processes are essential. You should be confident working independently while also being responsive and aligned with a Western-based team.



Working hours will align with Australian business hours, and availability during this time is required. This is a long-term role with the opportunity to grow as the business continues to expand.



Compensation for this role is up to USD 1,500 per month, depending on experience, skills, and availability. Final pay will be discussed with shortlisted candidates.



Strong written and spoken English is required. Prior experience working with Australian, US, or other Western clients is highly valued.



To apply, please complete the Google Form linked below. Applications that do not complete the form will not be reviewed. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted directly.

title: Social Media Video Production Expert (Remote)
description:
We need someone to coach us LIVE on how to shoot studio-clean talking-head videos, the output video we’ll use later to generate an AI avatar. (You are NOT creating the avatar.)

This is about camera angle, framing, lighting, audio, and setup decisions + leaving us with a repeatable system.



Immediate goal (this week):

- Room review call (today 8:00am PT) ? you tell us exactly what to buy

- Then 1–2 short working calls during the week to dial in: lighting, framing, audio, setup, and shooting workflow

- Output = clean, consistent A-roll we can repeat anytime



Constraints

- iPhone-only for this phase (no fancy camera required)

- Style target: global/modern / premium with a hip-hop edge (not corporate)





Time/cadence

- ~1–2 hours/day for the next 1–2 weeks

- Must be responsive in chat + able to hop on short calls if needed



Comp: $5–$20/hr (part-time to start)

If you’re great, this becomes ongoing coaching + continuous opportunity as we scale output — plus growth in scope (systems, creative direction, quality control) and real learning as you help build a production machine from the inside.

title: Shopify Data Analyst
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

Artie is a premium direct-to-consumer pet food subscription business combining hardware, consumables, and recurring revenue. We are seeking a part-time Data & Performance Analyst to support leadership by creating and maintaining a weekly KPI dashboard, analyzing performance trends, and delivering insights that guide growth, marketing efficiency, and investor reporting.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Weekly KPI Dashboard & Reporting

- Build and maintain a weekly executive KPI dashboard

- Ensure accuracy and consistency across metrics

- Track trends week-over-week and month-over-month



Cross-Platform Data Integration

Analyze and reconcile data across the following platforms:

- Shopify

- Recharge (subscription tool)

- Klaviyo

- Google Analytics

- Meta Ads

- Digioh (quiz platform)

- Attribution tools such as TripleWhale and Lifetimely



Subscription & Retention Analysis

- Monitor churn, retention, cohorts, and LTV

- Identify early warning signals in subscriber health

- Support pricing, offer, and funnel optimization analysis



Insights & Recommendations

- Provide clear written insights and recommendations

- Highlight what changed, why it matters, and where to act



Investor & Leadership Support

- Prepare metrics for leadership and investor reporting

- Maintain consistent, defensible metric definitions



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience with Shopify-based DTC businesses

- Strong data analysis and spreadsheet skills

- Understanding of core DTC KPIs (CAC, LTV, AOV, churn, ROAS)

- Ability to communicate insights clearly in writing

- High attention to detail



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

- Subscription-based businesses

- Recharge (or other subscription tools)

- TripleWhale / Lifetimely (or other attribution tools)

- Paid ad performance analysis (Meta, Google,
, affiliates, etc)

- Investor or executive reporting environments



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Leadership can quickly understand weekly performance

- Metrics are trusted and decision-ready

- Insights lead to improved marketing efficiency and retention



APPLICATION REQUEST

Please include:

- A brief summary of your relevant experience

- The tools and platforms you have worked with and experience level with the tools outlined above (or equivalents)

- Examples of DTC or subscription-based websites or brands you have supported (links or descriptions)

title: E-Commerce Operations & Growth Specialist VA
description:
Job Title: E-Commerce Operations & Growth Specialist

We are looking for a versatile and results-driven E-Commerce Virtual Assistant to join our team. This is a multi-faceted role designed for someone who thrives in the fast-paced world of online retail and understands the full funnel—from creating viral content to managing multi-channel marketplace operations.

The ideal candidate is a "Swiss Army Knife" of e-commerce, capable of switching between creative video editing, data-driven ad management, and marketplace management.

Key Responsibilities

1. Digital Advertising (Meta & Google Ads)

 * Set up, monitor, and optimize paid social campaigns 
/Instagram).

 * Manage Google Search and Shopping campaigns to maximize ROAS.

 * Perform A/B testing on ad copy, creatives, and landing pages.

2. Marketplace & Platform Management (The "Plus")

 * Multi-Channel Presence: Manage and optimize product listings across Lazada, Shopee, and TikTok Shop.

 * Campaign Participation: Coordinate store participation in mega-sale events (e.g., 11.11, 12.12) and flash sales.

 * Shop Performance: Monitor seller center health metrics, manage shop decorations, and respond to customer inquiries on marketplace platforms.

3.
 Marketing (eDM) & Retention

 * Campaign Management: Plan, design, and execute weekly
 newsletters and promotional broadcasts.

 * Automations (Flows): Set up and optimize essential automated flows (Abandoned Cart, Welcome Series, Post-Purchase).

 * Segmentation: Manage and segment the
 list to improve open and click-through rates.

4. Content Creation (TikTok & Social)

 * Edit high-energy, trend-aware videos for TikTok and Reels.

 * Create content specifically optimized for TikTok Shop shoppable videos.

 * Source/manage UGC and turn raw footage into high-converting video ads.

5. SEO & Store Management (WooCommerce)

 * SEO: Conduct keyword research and write SEO-optimized product titles, descriptions, and meta tags.

 * Store Ops: Upload and manage product listings, monitor inventory, and troubleshoot basic WooCommerce issues.

Requirements

 * Experience: Proven track record managing WooCommerce stores and running profitable ad campaigns.

 * Marketplace Savvy: Strong familiarity with Lazada Seller Center, Shopee Seller Centre, and TikTok Shop Academy.

 *
 Proficiency: Experience with platforms like Klaviyo, Mailchimp, or Omnisend.

 * Technical Skills: Proficiency in Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, and video editing tools (CapCut, Adobe Premiere, etc.).

 * Mindset: Proactive, detail-oriented, and able to work independently.

How to Apply

Please submit your resume along with:

 * A brief summary of your most successful e-commerce project.

 * A link to a portfolio or examples of TikTok/Reels you have edited.

 * A screenshot or description of your experience managing Lazada, Shopee, or TikTok Shop stores.

title: Event Planner & Administrator
description:
Role Overview

Contractor Dynamics is hiring a detail-oriented Event & Administrative Assistant to support client events and internal administrative tasks. This role combines event coordination execution with administrative support, making it ideal for someone who is highly organized, dependable, and comfortable following documented processes.

You will be responsible for coordinating logistics for client events, ordering print materials, and assisting with administrative responsibilities such as client onboarding and offboarding tasks, CRM updates, and accounts receivable follow-ups.

This is an execution-focused role. You will work from SOPs, checklists, and clear direction, with ownership over ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on time.



Location: Remote

Job Type: Hourly

Pay: $480/ mo for  ~20 hours of work



Key Responsibilities

Event Coordination

 - Book and coordinate client events, including venues and hotels

 - Research and secure event spaces based on provided requirements

 - Order and manage print materials for events (flyers, signage, handouts, etc.)

 - Track event timelines and ensure all logistics are completed before deadlines

 - Communicate with vendors, venues, and internal team members to confirm details

 - Maintain organized records of event bookings and confirmations



Administrative Support

 - Complete client onboarding tasks according to documented SOPs

 - Complete client offboarding tasks to ensure smooth transitions

 - Update and maintain CRM records (contacts, notes, statuses, billing updates)

 - Assist with general administrative tasks as assigned

 - Follow processes consistently and flag issues or missing information



Billing & Accounts Receivable Support

 - Make outbound calls to clients regarding outstanding invoices (A/R)

 - Communicate professionally and confidently when requesting payment

 - Document call outcomes and payment statuses accurately

 - Coordinate with leadership on unresolved billing issues

 - Be available for limited U.S. business hours at the end of each month for billing calls



Skills & Qualifications

 - Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

 - Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines

 - Clear, professional written and verbal communication

 - Comfortable making billing-related phone calls to clients

 - Ability to follow SOPs and checklists accurately

 - Basic experience with CRM tools or strong ability to learn quickly

 - Reliable internet and ability to work independently

 - Availability for limited U.S. time overlap when required



Bonus Points If:

 - Previous administrative assistant or virtual assistant experience

 - Event coordination or logistics experience

 - Experience working with CRM platforms such as HubSpot or GoHighLevel

 - Experience in a service-based or agency environment



This Role Isn’t For You If…

 - You don’t enjoy detail-oriented, deadline-driven work.

 - You struggle to take ownership and need constant oversight.

 - You aren’t open to feedback and continual learning.



What Success Looks Like

 - Events are booked correctly and on time

 - Print materials arrive accurately and on schedule

 - Client onboarding and offboarding tasks are completed without errors

 - CRM records are kept clean and current

 - Billing follow-ups are handled professionally and consistently

 - Leadership can rely on tasks being completed without reminders



What We Offer

 - Remote, flexible work environment.

 - Flexible working hours, with the expectation that client communication and meetings will be scheduled during U.S.-based business hours.

 - Opportunity to learn and grow inside a fast-scaling company.

 - Growth potential with increasing project volume.

 - A team culture built on accountability, excellence, and helping each other win.



About Contractor Dynamics

We help roofing companies transform their marketing in-house through strategic training and agency services, equipping teams to boost growth and ROI. Learn more about our mission here: 



Our Core Values

 - We Help Our Clients & One Another Win

 - We Continually Learn & Improve

 - We Are Trusted Advisors

 - We Are Impeccable With Our Word

 - We Embody Extreme Ownership

title: Solutions Consultant – Retail Software (Product Adoption)
description:
Solutions Consultant – Retail Software (Product Adoption)

We build retail software used by real businesses every day. Our platform is moving to modular apps across POS, WMS, purchasing, promotions, and integrations. The software exists. The opportunity is making sure customers actually use it.

We’re looking for a consulting-style, hands-on problem solver who likes working with customers, understands business processes, and enjoys turning real needs into working software with engineers.

What you’ll do

Work directly with retail customers to understand how their business operates





Demo apps and guide customers through real workflows





Identify gaps, bugs, and missing functionality blocking adoption





Translate customer needs into clear specs and engineering tickets





Work closely with engineers to prioritize, test, and validate fixes





Collaborate w/ support team to spot adoption and expansion opportunities





Push items forward until customers are live and actively using the product





The profile we’re looking for

3–6 years in a consulting, implementation, or solutions role





Experience with retail at management level, e-commerce, POS, ERP, WMS, or SaaS platforms

Software Engineer, project manager, business analyst  looking for new career paths

Strong understanding of business processes and workflows





Comfortable on customer calls and technical discussions





Able to demo software, write tickets, and test functionality





Proactive, organized, and willing to own problems end to end



This role is not for you if:

You need constant direction





You only want to analyze or plan





You avoid customer interaction





You prefer narrow responsibilities





Why this role matters

You’ll sit between customers and engineering. Your work directly influences product direction, customer success, and what gets built next. This role has real ownership and real impact.

title: Senior Project Manager with Architecture / Interior Design / Hospitality Procurement background
description:
Bluebird Lighting is growing! We are a market leader in custom lighting solutions for high-end hospitality, commercial, and retail projects. With headquarters in the United States and teams in China and the Philippines, we are building a globally connected organization focused on innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We empower our tea
mbers to grow alongside the company, take on meaningful responsibility, and contribute to projects that make a visible impact.



Job title : Senior Project Manager

Location: Remote

Department: Project Management

Reports To: Director for Global Operations

Salary Range : To be discussed - Based on relevant experience



Please complete this form to proceed with your application : 



ABOUT THE ROLE 

We are seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager to lead the execution of complex import projects while managing and mentoring a team of Project Managers / Coordinators. You will be given ownership for the management of key accounts and high-profile clients in large-scale hospitality and commercial projects. This role requires a highly organized, solutions-oriented professional who excels in customer advocacy, cross-functional coordination, and global manufacturing environments.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES : 



Provide end-to-end oversight of multiple high-complexity projects, managing multiple concurrent timelines, stakeholders, and deliverables from pre-award through closeout and after-sales support



Identify risks and develop mitigation strategies, conducting regular risk assessments with the Director for Global Operations



Serve as a senior customer advocate, proactively coordinating and clearly communicating with customers, manufacturers, sales teams, and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment and timely execution



Act as an escalation point for complex project, vendor, or customer issues, providing solutions-oriented approach and expectation management



Guide and support a team of Project Managers / Coordinators by overseeing the maintenance of project trackers, deliverables, project documentation, schedules, regular status reports, and client communications to ensure accuracy, consistency, and best practices



Partner closely with China-based manufacturing teams to ensure pricing, materials, and production methods align with client budgets, specifications, and quality standards



Build and review quotations, invoices, and purchase orders based on client requests, specifications, and manufacturer submittals



Contribute to continuous improvement of project management processes, templates, and workflows



Lead thorough reviews and approvals of shop drawings, finish samples, and mockups against specifications, documenting discrepancies and driving resolution



Conduct or oversee quality control reviews of products, packaging, and cargo prior to shipment, ensuring compliance with specifications and company standards



Oversee the creation and maintenance of company records, project milestones, and documentation within internal filing systems and HubSpot CRM



Coordinate shipping logistics with manufacturing teams, freight partners, and customers, proactively identifying and mitigating risks or delays



Manage project closeout, punch lists, and after-sales service, ensuring customer satisfaction and long-term relationship building



Perform other relevant duties as assigned by the company





MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS



5+ years of experience in project management, construction, manufacturing, or procurement, with increasing responsibility



PMP certification a plus



Demonstrated experience leading or mentoring Project Managers or junior tea
mbers



Bachelor’s degree required (Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, or Architecture is a plus)



Strong experience reading and interpreting technical drawings and specifications



Proven customer-facing experience with strong client advocacy and relationship management skills



Ability to work full time with occasional flexed hours to support global manufacturing timelines



High level of computer literacy, including Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM systems (CAD experience is a plus)



Excellent written and verbal English communication skills, including professional client correspondence



Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and consistently meet deadlines



Comfortable working in a high-growth, fast-changing environment with minimal supervision



Team-oriented leader and effective cross-functional collaborator



Solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to communicate issues, risks, and proposed resolutions clearly and in real time to leadership, internal teams, and external partners

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To: CEO

Work Hours: Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

• Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

• Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

• Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

• Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.



Regular Work Activities

• Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

• Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

• Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

• Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

• Reconcile inbound placement fees

• Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

• Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

• Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

• Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

• Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

• Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

• Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

• Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

• Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

• Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

• Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

• Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

• Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

• Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

• Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

• Advanced spreadsheet skills

• Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

• Strong analytical and investigative mindset

• High attention to detail

• Ability to reconcile complex datasets

• Process-driven

• Cost-reduction oriented thinking

• Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

• Direct report to the CEO

• Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education

• 2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

• Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

• Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

• Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

• E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

• Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

• Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

• Strong personal accountability

• Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping

Click the link - 
/o/JB-AGUZM8V3D/landing?u=

description:
ABOUT US



We're a rapidly growing real estate media company in the United States serving professional real estate agents. We specialize in fast-turnaround professional photography. We're scaling aggressively and need reliable help with our production operations.



---



THE ROLE: Media Quality Control & Photo Editor



You'll handle our complete photo processing and delivery workflow, allowing our team to focus on client acquisition and growth. This is systematic production work using our established tools and quality standards - not creative editing or client-facing work.



---



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



- Process raw photo files through our editing workflow

- Perform quality control on edited images

- Handle light touch-ups and corrections as needed

- Upload finalized photos to our client delivery platform

- Schedule deliveries according to service level commitments

- Track orders and status in our project management system

- Communicate any issues or questions via team chat

- Maintain our quality standards and turnaround time commitments



WORKFLOW: You'll follow our documented step-by-step process for each order. We'll train you on everything.



---



TOOLS & SYSTEMS:



You'll be trained on our complete tech stack, including:

- Cloud-based photo editing platform (AI-assisted)

- Client delivery and gallery system

- File sharing and storage (Dropbox/Google Drive)

- Project tracking (Google Sheets)

- Team communication (Slack)

- Basic photo editing tools for touch-ups



NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE WITH OUR SPECIFIC TOOLS REQUIRED - we'll train you. But you must be comfortable learning cloud-based software quickly.



---



SCHEDULE & AVAILABILITY:



- Work hours: 12pm-8pm US Central Time 

- Starting commitment: 15-20 hours per week

- Growth potential: 30-40+ hours per week as our volume increases

- Must have reliable high-speed internet (minimum 10 Mbps upload for photo files)

- Busiest days are mid-week (Tuesday-Thursday)



---



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:



MUST HAVE:

- Photo editing experience (real estate, product photography, or similar)

- Comfortable with cloud-based tools and workflows

- Extremely detail-oriented with quality focus

- Excellent written English for documentation

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Available to start within 7 days

- Comfortable with systematic, repeatable work



HIGHLY PREFERRED:

- Real estate photography or media production experience

- Experience with AI tools

- Previously worked US hours

- Fast learner who can master new tools quickly

- Self-starter who can work independently once trained



---



COMPENSATION & GROWTH:



STARTING PAY: $7/hour USD

STARTING HOURS: 15-20 hours per week  

PAYMENT STRUCTURE: Starting hourly, potential to move to per-project rate after probation period



GROWTH TRAJECTORY:

As our business scales, the right person will have opportunity to:

- Increase to 30-40 hours per week

- Transition to performance-based compensation

- Take on additional responsibilities or training roles

- Grow income significantly as volume increases



This is NOT a short-term project - we're building a long-term team.



---



WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT:



Work exclusively with one company (not juggling multiple clients)

Clear, documented processes (not "figure it out yourself")

Fast-growing business (your role grows with us)

Direct communication with leadership

We value efficiency - suggest improvements and we'll listen

Stable, recurring work (not feast-or-famine)



---



TO APPLY - ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS:



Please include ALL of the following in your application (incomplete applications will be ignored):



1. EXPERIENCE:

   • Describe your photo editing background

   • Have you worked with real estate or property photography?

   • What editing platforms/tools have you used?



2. TECHNICAL SETUP:

   • What is your internet upload speed? (Test at fast.com)

   • Do you have a backup internet option if your main connection fails?

   • What hours are you available within our 12pm-8pm Central window?



3. WORK STYLE:

   • Describe a time you maintained quality while working under tight deadlines

   • How do you handle repetitive, systematic work?

   • What do you do when you encounter a problem you don't know how to solve?



4. LOGISTICS:

   • When can you start?

   • Are you comfortable working Philippines graveyard shift long-term?

   • Are you currently working other jobs? If yes, can you commit to our schedule?



5. PORTFOLIO (if available):

   • Link to examples of photos you've edited (real estate preferred)

   • OR briefly describe your typical editing workflow



---



THIS ROLE IS NOT:

- Creative photography or artistic editing

- Client communication or customer service

- Social media management

- Sales or marketing



THIS ROLE IS:

- Systematic photo processing workflow

- Quality control and attention to detail

- Reliable, consistent execution

- Following established processes

- Contributing to a fast-growing team



---



IMPORTANT: Due to the proprietary nature of our workflows and tools, detailed information about our specific systems will be shared only with candidates selected for interviews. We'll provide everything you need to know during the hiring process.



If you're detail-oriented, reliable, experienced with photo editing, and ready to commit to this role, apply now with complete answers to all questions above.



Applications without complete answers will not be considered.

title: Extremely Detail Oriented Virtual Assistant - Data Entry & Order Fulfillment
description:
Hello,



I have a small e-commerce industrial supply company in the USA. We receive orders on our websites and we place those order with our vendors on their websites who drop ships the order directly to our customers. We are the distributor (also called the "middleman" by some people). You will be working directly with me (the owner) everyday.



You will reply to
s that come into our general sales inbox. Most of these
s are to check stock availability and price of items.



You will make 10-20 phone calls per day to our vendors to check availability of items and also call customers if additional details are required about their order. 



You will place orders online with our vendors which will drop ship direct to our customers.



We are hiring for a full time, long term Virtual Assistant who will enter new orders on our vendors websites and also enter tracking information to fill orders on our websites. This position will work 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week Monday - Friday during USA hours (10pm-6pm Manila time). You must be exclusive to this job, you cannot do other work or side jobs if hired. Your full concentration must be on this job.



Requirements for this position:



- CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS / COMMON SENSE

- Fast on the computer, writing
s and using internet

- Great English speaking and writing skills

- Long term position (we want this person to be with us for years)

- 10pm-6am daily Manila time. Monday to Friday

- Extreme attention to details (THIS IS A MUST)

- Excellent with numbers and math

- Excellent with Data entry

- Honest and Loyal

- Willing to learn and ask questions

- WILL NOT DISAPPEAR

- Expert working on a computer

- Expert using
 (Gmail)

- Expert using the internet and placing orders online

- Great with Microsoft Excel and Word

- Knows how to use

- Reliable internet connection



A very simple explanation of this job: You will take the orders we receive on our websites (you will receive order details by
) and place those orders with our vendors on their websites. EXTREME ATTENTION TO DETAILS & NUMBERS is required.



Over time you will receive additional responsibilities but it will also be related to processing and filling orders. A few times per day you may need to call/email vendors for stock and price check. A few times per day you may need to call/email our customers to provide lead time or order updates.



Once our vendor has shipped the order you will take the UPS / Fedex tracking numbers and you will fill orders in our ---------- is not a complicated job but you must be extremely detail oriented.

- We must ship the correct items to our customers

- We must ship to correct item quantity to our customers

- We must ship to the correct customer address





To make sure you have fully read this job description in your application
 please include this in the subject and as the first line: "I am the perfect VA001!!!"



Thank You

Neil

title: UGC Manager – DTC, Paid Social & Performance Creative
description:
We’re looking for a highly organized and performance-driven UGC Manager to lead creators and produce native, conversion-focused content for paid social. This role sits at the intersection of creative direction and performance marketing, owning the full UGC lifecycle from sourcing creators to delivering launch-ready assets.



You’ll be responsible for building and managing a creator roster, translating strategy into high-performing short-form content, and continuously improving creative output using performance data.



RESPONSIBILITIES



-Source, vet, and onboard UGC creators aligned with brand and campaign goals.

-Manage creator workflows end-to-end, including briefs, scripts, feedback, revisions, approvals, and final delivery.

-Translate strategy into clear shot lists, hooks, scripts, and CTAs optimized for TikTok, Meta, and short-form platforms.

-Collaborate with strategists to ideate, test, and iterate creative concepts, angles, and openers.

-Coach creators on storytelling, framing, pacing, lighting, and on-camera delivery to reduce reshoots.

-Oversee contracts, rates, usage rights, and deliverables while tracking timelines and budgets.

-Maintain an organized multi-project pipeline and ensure assets are QC’d and launch-ready.

-Use performance data to refine creatives toward stronger CTR, CVR, CPA, and ROAS.

-Build and maintain repeatable UGC playbooks and best-practice documentation.



REQUIREMENTS



-Proven experience in UGC management, influencer marketing, or performance creative.

-Strong understanding of short-form paid social content and platform best practices.

-Excellent English communication with the ability to give clear, actionable feedback.

-Strong eye for storytelling, authenticity, and emotional resonance on camera.

-Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple creators and projects simultaneously.

-Performance mindset with an understanding of how creative impacts acquisition metrics.



BONUS SKILLS



-Experience building and scaling a creator database.

-Knowledge of creator licensing, usage rights, and whitelisting.

-Ability to write or refine UGC scripts for testimonials, problem-solution, and product demos.

-Familiarity with short-form video editing workflows, captions, and pacing.

-Experience analyzing creative performance and sharing insights with stakeholders.

title: UGC Creator Needed — Short-Form Video Content for Faith-Based App (Remote)
description:
We're building Bible Guide, a faith-based mobile app that helps Christians deepen their faith through daily devotionals, guided prayer, Scripture-based AI chat, and personalized spiritual guidance. Our mission is simple: help people get closer to God, every day.



We're growing fast and looking for UGC creators to join us long-term and help get this app in front of the people who need it. We need authentic short-form videos. Reactions, testimonials, app walkthroughs, personal takes. The kind of content that feels like a real person genuinely sharing something they found, not a scripted ad.



This is a dedicated UGC role. You're not managing strategy or editing other people's footage. You're the face (or voice) on camera, creating content that feels native to the platform and natural to a US audience.





???? WHAT YOU'LL DO



- Create short-form UGC videos (30-90 seconds) for TikTok and Instagram Reels. Think reactions, personal testimonials, "I found this app" moments, app feature walkthroughs, day-in-my-life clips, that kind of thing.

- Run your own TikTok and Instagram account dedicated to this content. We provide the accounts and a US residential address to connect them to.

- Follow a warm-up routine we provide to get the account active and reaching the right audience. If you've done this before, great. If not, we'll guide you through it.

- Post consistently based on a schedule we agree on together.

- Experiment with different hooks, formats, and angles to find what resonates.

- Keep it authentic. The content should feel like it belongs on someone's For You page, not like an ad.





???? WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



- Comfortable on camera, or comfortable creating content that feels personal (voiceover, screen recordings with narration, etc.)

- Good English. If you're a native or near-native speaker, you can speak directly on camera. If your spoken English isn't quite there, that's totally fine. You can use captions, text overlays, or AI-generated voiceover. What matters is the final content feels natural for a US/Western audience.

- You know what works on TikTok and Instagram Reels. You know what a good hook looks like, you understand pacing, and you've scrolled enough to have a feel for what stops people.

- Reliable and self-motivated. You'll be managing your own posting schedule and we need someone who actually follows through.

- Open to the faith space. You don't need to be a theologian, but a genuine interest in or connection to the Christian faith helps the content feel real rather than forced. If you're someone who wants to use their creative skills to help bring people closer to God, this is the role.

- Bonus: Experience running accounts from scratch, warming up new accounts, or working with VPN/residential proxy setups.





???? HOW IT WORKS



- You can be based anywhere in the world. US, Europe, Southeast Asia, Africa, South America, wherever. We're hiring globally to find great people at fair rates.

- We provide a US residential address for your TikTok and Instagram accounts so the content reaches a US audience.

- We provide an account warm-up guide. It's a step-by-step routine to get a new account active, established in the right niche, and reaching real viewers before you start posting content. If you've done this before, even better.

- You'll run your own dedicated accounts. This isn't posting to our main brand account. You're building individual creator-style accounts that feel personal and authentic.

- We'll work closely with you, especially at the start, to dial in what's working.





???? PAY AND GROWTH



- You'll be on a monthly retainer so you have a stable base and can focus on making great content without worrying about chasing hours.

- On top of the retainer, you earn performance bonuses when your videos hit view milestones. When the content wins, you win. We want to be properly aligned on this.

- This is a long-term role. We're not looking for someone to make a few videos and disappear. We want creators who want to grow with us, get better over time, and build something meaningful together.

- As we scale, there's real room to grow your role and your earnings. The creators who stick around and perform well will be the backbone of how we reach people.





???? HOW TO APPLY



Send me:



1. A short intro. Who you are, where you're based, and a bit about your background.

2. 2-3 examples of UGC-style content you've created. This could be from your own accounts, client work, or even something you film as a quick sample. I want to see how you come across on camera or in voiceover, not a polished portfolio.

3. Your rate or expected monthly retainer.

4. A sentence or two on why this interests you, especially if you have any connection to the faith space.



Serious candidates will be given a paid test video before we commit to anything ongoing.

title: Outbound Cold Caller / Hybrid Sales (US Businesses)
description:
READ CAREFULLY — this is NOT a VA, admin, or customer support role.



We are hiring ONE confident, direct, thick-skinned cold caller to contact US service-based businesses.



If you are uncomfortable hearing phrases like “not interested,” “I’m busy,” or blunt responses, do not apply.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



You must have experience with at least ONE:



Cold calling US businesses



Outbound sales to American prospects



Call center experience handling US accounts



Insurance, real estate, or lead-generation cold calling (USA)



Chat,
, or inbound-only experience is not sufficient.



OFFICIAL DAILY EXPECTATIONS



This role is designed for focused calling blocks, not long shifts.



4–5 hours per day



80–120 calls/day target



Minimum acceptable: 70



Ideal: 100



Great: 120



Calls are short, direct, and controlled.

This gives flexibility without softness.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



Cold call US businesses

Identify interest or pain

PAY & EARNINGS



Commission-first

Base pay added after performance



You are paid for results, not hours.



HOW TO APPLY



Apply using this form (required):
